Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: RobinWofford
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days in Hotel Grifo and had a wonderful time. The hotel is minutes away from tourist attractions, shopping and a great resturant down the street from the hotel. Go out the door, take a right and stop at the corner, the resturant is on the left. wonderful food and staff. The rooms are small and the bathroom but no different then traveling anywhere else in Europe. We would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience at The Grifo”
Reviews.Author: Paula S
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Grifo beginning April and can honestly say our first two days in the apartment block over the road from the hotel was awful, however and our last two days in the main hotel were much better. The apartment block across from the Grifo holds three hotel rooms on the second floor (no lift) of a private apartment block which is in the process of having its front facia updated, so is scaffolded and covered in sheeting. The room was TINY. It was really a single room with a double bed in it, which was really cramped. The room was dark with old furniture and a stained bed quilt and we had to keep the shutters and curtains closed due to scaffold and builders walking past our 2nd floor windows all hours. Luckily after two days there was a flood in the building, so we got moved to a triple room in the main hotel which was much better experience - light bright, could actually open our shutters and all round so much better. I would NOT recommend the apartments over the road, even when the refurb is finished. With regard to the rest of the hotel, we liked the roof terrace, and the hotel receptionists were pleasant. Breakfast was basic - untoasted bread and croissants - buy a toaster Grifo management - this is a basic breakfast requirement! We loved Rome and enjoyed ourselves immensely in the city and the weather and italian people and dining experiences were just great. Despite a great location near the Collosseum, based on our first two days experience at this hotel, we would not return. PS watch out at check out - the manager said we owed an additional 16 Euros in CASH no RECEIPT as we were Expedia customers for 'tax'. We insisted on a receipt, which he didnt want to do. What is this all about?

Reviews.Title: “good for budget stay”
Reviews.Author: Jan K
Reviews.Content: Good for a budget stay. Includes breakfast and free WiFi. Beds and mattresses were quite old but okay. They have friendly staff too. Location is near to Colosseo and metro station. Not bad after all.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money and helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: nique10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights the week just before Easter. If you looking for a hotel close to ancient Rome this is it. Approximately a 10 min stroll to the Colosseum and Forum. To get to the Trevi fountian is about a 20min walk. (I'm a fast walker, but cant think it will take more than 30mins?). You can get the number 40 bus from close by to the Vatican. It really is so well situated and easy to get around. The staff were very friendly and helpful - even before we arrived and responded to emails very quickly. Very knowledgeable on the area - great suggestions on restaurants and sites. The free wifi is another bonus! In this day and age I dont understand why more hotels dont offer this. The hotel also has a terrace that you can use for a quiet drink at the end of a long day. If I have to give a negative it would be that we had probably the worlds smallest shower, but really thats nothing to complain about. The room was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, helpful friendly staff, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Bullbrand77
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for about 5 days and can highly recommend this hotel. The location is brilliant. Walking distance form the Coloseum, Trebvi fountain, Spanish steps, Roman forum, etc etc etc. The only place we took a bus to was the Vatican, but it can be walked in 20-ish minutes if you are up to it. Nice roof terrace as well. No food or drinks up there, but get some wine and a pizza and it makes a fine place to relax. The staff were very helpful as well. The room was rather small and the shower almost unworkably small. Breakfast adequate but not great. This is however very minor things compared to what you pay, where you are and how helpful everyone is. I can highly recommend hotel Grifo. Not the most luxuruious hotel, but very good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: wbjusa
Reviews.Content: Close to the Colosseum, forum, palatine hill, etc Competent, friendly staff. Arranged transportation, made reservations at the Borghese, etc. Substantial breakfast. Rooms are small - but this is Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: skygirl07
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel was extremely friendly, helpful and courteous from the minute we arrived handing us a map with great knowledge of the area to the moment of our departure. The location was superb, just an 8 minute walk to the Colosseum and 5 minutes walk to any form of transportation including metro and buses which is the best way to get around the center. While the room was on the smaller side it was always clean and adequate if you are not looking for a luxury stay. If you are looking for a place to sleep with various restaurants around with a small town feel in a big city this is the place for you. When I visit Rome in the future my plans will be to stay at Hotel Grifo. P.S. After eating gelato every day around various locations in Rome we found "Il Gelatone" Gelateria, less then a block away on Via Serpenti, to be THE BEST!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “good location but thats all!”
Reviews.Author: hantslily
Reviews.Content: Bad points:: small cramped dusty room overlooking the road (told it was a "large"!!),noisy, felt like a cell, painted horrid green,cold, marble floor (ok in summer I guess) fridge didnt work, dowdy lighting, hard as rock beds and pillows, awful stained,faded inadequate cover on bed ( it was snowing outside), no tea/coffee facilities or kettles available to rent,bathroom was made for a stick insect, no room to move,sliding door about a foot from the bed so no privavcy when using the loo!! shower cold for the first 5 minutes then intermittent, flaking paint on bathroom ceiling and cupboard, lack of toilet rolls.FREEZING COLD cramped breakfast room, only went once in 6 day stay it was so miserable and breakfast uninspiring.No where to sit/relax outside your "cell". Good points: VERY helpful,friendly staff in reception, good location for sights etc, nice sheets and towels. What was supposed to be a romantic break over Valentines was ruined by the cold,depressing feel of this place as the room was far from the nice pics shown on the website.Its ok if you want a bed (albeit hard) close to the centre, but not alot else!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: ItalyLove001
Reviews.Content: Our room looked nothing like the pictures. The lobby is actually across the street from the hotel room. It was the smallest room we had in Italy. The beds were very hard! We had our worst sleep here. The phone was out of service the entire 4 nights we stayed there. Every time we needed to use the phone, we had to go down 4 flights of stairs and across the street to use the lobby phone. Our room had so much dust. I will say that it is in a great location since it is near the Coloseum. There are also a lot of shops, cafes, and churches around it. The breakfast was okay. It was sweet bread, cheese and meat, and yogurt. If anything, stay here for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Great location Great price!”
Reviews.Author: Ronnie M
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here exploring rome Jan 2012 & could not of found a better hotel for the price etc. Staff were helpfull , room clean, & heating was fantastic, had to turn the heating down as our room was boiling hot & for January in rome thats fantastic. Room was small but everything was there & after a days sightseeing we slept like a log. Roof terrace was a bonus. We recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a great price”
Reviews.Author: Ebocrombi
Reviews.Content: This was my third time in Rome, but my first time in Hotel Grifo. My boyfriend and I stayed here from January 19th to January 22nd, 2012. We booked through Expedia and paid a total of 162 Euro for a three night stay, which is an unbeatable price for the location! You can walk to every attraction, and take a night stroll around the Colosseum, which is less than 10 minutes away. After reading the reviews, I was a bit concerned about having a shared bathroom and about problems with the heating, so I wrote an e-mail and got an answer right away. They told me we would have our own ensuite bathroom, and that heating problems were already fixed. They're really nice and attentive, so if you have any doubts, e-mail them. Our room (122) was not as small as people say, perhaps we were lucky. It was a normal room, only the shower was tiny. We had a window in the room an another in the bathroom, both facing the street, but we didn't suffer any noise because the windows are new. The bed was really comfortable, and everything was spotlessly clean. Decoration was quite tasteless, but hey, we only went there to sleep. The only thing I didn't like at all was the door; it seemed ancient and didn't fit the frame, so you could actually see the room's ceiling through a strip from the outside. Also, the key was very old and key wards were inexistent, so I'm pretty sure it would have fitted in other door's locks. It's a small place, so you didn't get a sense of insecurity because nobody can sneak inside without people noticing, but being a woman I wouldn't stay there on my own. Breakfast was simple but nice; good coffee, croissants, cereal, juice, nutella, etc. I missed a toaster for the bread. Free Wifi is a plus, and location is so nice that I'd probably stay there again. But please... NEW DOORS!

Reviews.Title: “!Good location, but......”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoItalia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in the summer of 2011. Very small, basic room. Beds were not too comfortable, but all seemed clean. Refrigerator was broken, but quickly replaced. Air conditioning strength was poor. Thank goodness for the terrace! After a very long day of sightseeing, it was nice to be able to sit outside and relax with our family, but still have some privacy. Shower extremely small, and I am a thin person. Breakfast had a good variety, but coffee is not ready until 6:00 a.m. (we're used to getting up and out early!). If I came down at 5:45 a.m. for coffee/tea only, the person (man) putting it out seemed very put off. When we checked in, the person working at that time (Jonelle) told us the room would not be ready until 1:00 p.m. So we went out for several hours, coming back at 12:50 p.m. He said it was not yet ready, so we took a seat in the bar area. At 1:00 p.m. I walked over to where I was sitting and asked him if it was ready and he said yes. So why could we not have gotten the room ten minutes sooner? Simple, he just wasn't going to do that. Before arriving at this hotel, I had confirmed that the price of our stay was good whether we paid with cash or credit card. I brought a copy of the confirmation email with, but not the particular page that said the price was the same, whether paid by cash or charge. So, of course, at checkout, Jonelle (again) would not honor the price quoted.....I showed him the page that quoted the price, but I didn't have the page with me that said the price wouldn't change if I used a credit card....Oh well, my mistake, right? After getting home, I attempted to resolve this matter with Rose, via email, and was given the complete run around; Live and learn, right? When I called my credit card company about this, they said "unfortunately, we see this sort of thing all the time in Italy". Truly unfortunate. Other than this incident, we enjoyed our stay in Italy. Bottom line, I would look elsewhere for lodging next time. Nearby, there are some decent, inexpensive places to grab a bite, close to Colleseum, grocery store (for cheap beer!!), short cab to Termini, bus to Vatican City. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the price”
Reviews.Author: JTanSingapore
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed there in late Nov-early December 2011. I am writing this because I had benefited from all the reviews of this and other hotels I got from Tripadvisor 1) great location - easy to zip back and use the toilets if necessary. Highly recommend you walk to/from all locations, even the Vatican City which is the attraction that is the furthest away. (Staff suggested we took the bus but it was hard to find the bus stop. In the end we asked someone on the street who told it was easier to take the Metro than the bus. Thank goodness the tickets we bought from the newsagent could be used for both the Metro and bus). Apart from the exercise you will get, you will avoid crowds in the buses which ply the tourist routes, which are famous for pickpockets 2) breakfast adequate though would have preferred more variety. Staff may be a bit slow in replenishing some breads so do go down early for breakfast 3) staff spoke reasonable English but directions given were not always clear 4) room small - had to always pack our luggage up to make room - but clean. Adequate for a night's rest 5) There is a grocery store nearby - good for buying fruits and bottled water To get to the hotel from Termini be prepared to walk (when with luggage) up to half an hour (not 10min as stated on the hotel website) as the cobbled stones don't make it easy to drag any luggage. But persevere, following the directions on the website. Be warned that all travel guidebooks' maps are not so detailed, so you may think you have missed a street since you may feel you have walked a long way but don't see the street the hotel is on. If you prefer to take the Metro from Termini to Cavour station, you will need to climb up quite a lot of steps to reach the level where the hotel is, so you may not want to attempt that where you have luggage to pull/push along (instead of a backpack). However, when leaving the hotel, it will be easier to take the Metro from Cavour, because the line going towards Termini is built on a higher level than the line from Termini - no need to climb any steps 6) they do have a lift (all the rooms are not on the ground floor). It does work well, but it is very tiny so if you are travelling in a group/have lots of luggage you will not be able to enter all at the same time) 7) If you book directly via the hotel website (like I did), and pay in cash, there is an 8% discount. The discount is less if you had booked it through an agent (cannot recall what the manager quoted - may have been 5%, but luckily I remembered the 8% figure so I clarified with him. He checked that our booking was directly to the hotel, then confirmed that it was 8%)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: dhs56
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed at Hotel Grifo in July for 1 night. Everything was great, we were all in one room, while a tight fit, we all fit, luggage and all! The staff was so accommodating and helpful. The included breakfast was fine and appreciated! The location was perfect for all our site seeing needs, especially the Colosseum! The A/C was great and much needed! Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “good value--great location”
Reviews.Author: mckinneymom2
Reviews.Content: This was a great value and amazing location. A VERY short walk to the Colosseum. The rooms were comfortable--but not updated or decorated well. Breakfast was nice. We would stay again for the accessibilty to all major sites.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location in terms of attractions, neighbourhood, shops and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Morten R
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent the days between Christmas and New Year's Eve 2011 in Rome where we stayed at Hotel Grifo. We picked the hotel after closely examining different hotels and their rating at Tripadvisor and we definitely made the right choice, This hotel has about the most perfect location in Rome I can imagine. The relaxing Boschetto street the hotel lies in and the surrounding streets are filled with great reastaurants (I can in particularly recommend 'La Taverna Dei Monti') which were easily found with the brilliant Tripadvisor Rome app. The area the hotel lies in is very cozy and really gives you the feeling of being in Rome with its narrow, slopy and cobbled streets surronded by fantastic architecture. Most of the top tourist attractions we visited were within walking distance and those that weren't, were easily acessed through the metro. The nearest stations is not far away from the hotel. The staff was very welcoming, the room was appropriately sized, the aircondition worked great as both a heater and a cooler of the room, the toilet and bath suited the basic needs and the breakfast was simple yet satisfying. We found the beds were a bit hard though but it was nothing that ruined the overall good impression of the hotel. All in all we had a great stay at Hotel Grifo and we got great value compared to price. We'll definitely consider living here again the next time we stop by Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Roman Holiday far from Via Margutta”
Reviews.Author: painter/traveler
Reviews.Content: If Joe Bradley had taken the Princess to the Hotel Grifo, there would have been a decidedly different outcome. Nonetheless, the Hotel Grifo more than makes up for what it lacks in glamor and panache with outstanding value and a superb location. From the tiny room on the top floor, you have a view, albeit narrow, of the Coliseum and the usual hodgepodge of latticework, rooftop gardens and clothes lines. – Romans tend to view their roofs as extensions of their apartments. Historic building or not, I was nearly on the verge of buying a bottle of Fantastic and a sponge and cleaning up the scuff marks all over the room. Although, to be fair, all but the most slender among us would be hard pressed to walk around the bed without banging into the wall. Initially, we balked and asked to see another room. The staff did their best to accommodate and offered to move us into a much larger room for the same price. We viewed at least three rooms, but decided to stay put due to the sunlight and the view. Our room felt more like a tree house perched atop the hotel than a regular hotel room. Reachable by a narrow and rickety steel staircase, it boasted a lovely balcony for morning coffee. Among the staff, Alessandro deserves special mention as particularly hospitable and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff, compact rooms”
Reviews.Author: trainfan2000
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is located in the heart of Old Rome. Easy walking distance to the Colosseum, the Forum, Trevi Fountain and many other "must see" sights. There are some excellent restaurants in the area that the concierge will recommend if asked. The hotel staff are very friendly and are more than willing to assist you. The rooms are compact but this is to be expected as you are staying in a 300 year old building that was once a bordello (about 100 years ago). The facility is clean, the bed linen of good quality, and the mattresses are comfortable. It has the only triangular shaped elevator I have ever seen - really quite unique. If you have mobility problems make sure that you ask to stay in the main building, not the annex, as the main building has the elevator. You will still be faced with a couple of steps to get to your room, but it should not be an issue. The showers are small but functional. The continental breakfast included cereal, croissants, pastries, coffee and tea. In summary, the hotel offers a great location and good service at a reasonable price, just be prepared for compact rooms.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Florian300
Reviews.Content: the location and the staff are to be mentioned. Breakfast very poor, rooms just basic and very cold. Bathroom is at the last days of its life.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: double42
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 25/25 Nov 2011.More than happy with loction and ease of finding. Just off the Via Nazionale Staff very friendly.And helpful Hotel verry clean.Happy with room as I came to see Rome and not the hotel.Although I would say my room had the smallest shower in Rome. would say was I was not happy the 8 euro (4pp)city tax I had to pay when booking out beware. Check tariffs before buying from bars near tourist sites you could be in for a expensive shock!!

Reviews.Title: “Central location, good service, but rooms quite simple”
Reviews.Author: traveller68Finland
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located in the vicinity of Colosseo, Forum Romanum and other main historical attractions and also metro station is very close. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Yet,the rooms were a bit of a disappointment for me- they were quite small and basic (I understand these are old buildings), mostly what disturbed us was the dampness in the room and that the heating didn't seem to work properly for some reason. My parents stayed in another room on the top floor with a terrace and that room was better and warmer/no dampness. Rooms were cleaned daily and towels changed. The breakfast was good enough with rolls, croissants, cheese, turkey, salami, youghurt, cereals etc.- ok every day it was exactly the same (it would have been nice if they would have changed the variety of sausages etc.). Yet, concerning what price we paid (only 68€) it was value for money and I can reccommend this hotel for people who don't require too much luxury, but appreciate good service and location.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location!!!”
Reviews.Author: snoopysnose
Reviews.Content: As has already been said, the location of this hotel is brilliant!! you dont need metro passes as most of the places you will want to visit are walking distance!! but if you do want the metro its 5 min walk away! Grifo is in an old building on a charming cobbled street , right in the centre of rome! round the corner from the hotel you can see the colosseum at the end of the road. we had 2 rooms first room...room 25 was large and had a lovely modern bathroom and great shower !! and the best thing about our room was a terrace with table and 5 chairs !! lovely for an evening glass of wine!! our friends room on the 3rd floor was much smaller and less modern, but to be honest for the price we paid the first room was a massive bonus!! reception staff were lovely ! its 24 hour and we felt very secure. it was very clean with plenty of thick white fresh towells every day, breakfast was nice too. i would recommend november as its very warm and sunny!!! no queues really at major attractions!( we did go mid-week) all in all would recommend!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good central location for sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: SunseekerKD
Reviews.Content: The main benefit of this hotel is its location within walking distance of most of the main sites, and is a good price for that reason. It was basically clean with friendly staff. The rooms we had were a bit tired (perhaps the renovation hadnt reached them) but clean and reasonably comfortable. All we needed as we were out all day sight seeing. Breakfast was a simple self service, urns of coffee and hot water, cereals, and I think there were croissants or something similar. The shower we had (again, possibly pre renovation) had very low water pressure and wasnt very hot. In fact there was no hot water on the last day. For the price it was a good base for the centre of a major city.

Reviews.Title: “Book for the location”
Reviews.Author: Due_Caffe
Reviews.Content: The hotel was walking distance to everything we wanted to see which is what attracted us to this place to begin with. The room was basic but quite clean. The shower was tiny so fortunately we're average-sized people (but if you drop anything, good luck picking it up!). The pressure in the shower was very low and stopped spraying completely a few times. Breakfast was typical of hotels in Italy. The wi-fi rarely worked during our stay and only down in the lobby. The staff was very helpful and arranged transportation for us when needed. Overall, this is a good, no-frills hotel but the location makes the stay worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “grifo”
Reviews.Author: khalil a
Reviews.Content: We had great time here!!! The location is perfect! 5 minutes from the Colosseum! The area is wonderfull!!! We love the restaurants and gelato place! The rooms are really clean, and the breakfast is good.. I love the coffea! A good start in the morning.. You can find different type of bread, cereals, nutella!!! Really enjoy it! Try to have breakfast on the terrace!!!! The staff? Awesome!! Helpfull and very good in giving tips how to visit Rome! And for the restaurants try "taverna dei monti"! Or "la carbonara"! Both are near the hotel.. Wi-fi is free but only in the lobby.. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: MCC2011
Reviews.Content: Great location, centrally located within the ruins we so wanted to visit. We stayed on the 4th floor. The room was large enough to accomodate us, although faintly moldy, and we had to purchase allergy medication in the nearby pharmacy on our first day to endure our spore allegies. When the terrace door would be open we would smell a natural gas escape, immediately nearby, so we kept it shut as much as possible. Other than that, and the minor city block-wide electricity failure (hardly within Hotel Grifo's power) we were delighted to be hosted by such wonderful staff as Louigie, Alessandro, Angela and of course our great Rosa, who took care of us even before we arrived to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Abbiecus
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i were so excited to find our hotel located only 5 mins away from the colosseum- the reason we were so intent on visiting Rome in the first place! The hotel is down a lovely atmospheric street and is in the heart of the city, there are restaurants galore and so many things to see and do in the city so close by. Our room was basic but comfortable, had a great shower and was lovely to watch the world pass by out of our window. breakfast was good- you need it with so much to do and see during the day! The staff helped us whenever we needed it and were warm and friendly.We felt very safe and happy the whole time we vitisted the city and had just a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “hotel grifo”
Reviews.Author: harrabi m
Reviews.Content: Good location, good rooms, perfect staff We stay at Hotel Grifo and really enjoy it.. The hotel is in a small street near the main street via nazionale.. The location was perfect.. Walking distance from the most important spots of the city! (5min from the Colosseum!!) Nice neighborhood where you can find very good restaurants, small shops, supermarket, etc.. The room was a little bit small but in the city center you can not expect more.. Comfortable beds and clean rooms.. Chamber maids very friendly, and a good breakfast.. The staff are super helpfull!! They will show you where to eat good food and give you good tips how to visit Rome! (Roma pass is a good deal!! ) We will stay again here on our next trip in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!!!!”
Reviews.Author: reesecup77
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great and the staff was very helpful. We enjoyed the convenience of it's location and the hotel staff's recommendation for restaurants. Loved the small terrace to sit at night wit a glass of wine and laugh about our excursions!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Milton5561
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 4 night stay at the Hotel Griffo. If you are looking for the luxury of a British 5 Star this is not the hotel for you. BUT, if you are looking for a really good base from which to explore Rome, then this hotel is well worth a look. The hotel is very clean although some of the paintwork is starting to look just a little bit 'tired'. Our room No. 28 on the 2nd floor had a small but adequate built in wardrobe, dressing table, large double bed, bedside cabinets, air con tv and ensuite which had a toilet that was also a bidet. (Look for the lever on the left hand side of the wall). The shower was more than adequate. The shower tray may fill up if you are in there quite a while - but don't be alarmed, it never gets so full that it overflows!!!! The double glazing definitely kept out the noise of the street. Although the hotel is not on a main road, locals use it every morning and evening on their commute to/from work, The continental breakfast was plentiful, 3 different types of cerals and cold cuts, hard and cream cheese, orange and pineapple juice, a variety of bread, rolls and croissants, jams, honey and nuttela. Coffee tea and fruit teas. Perhaps the only missing ingredient being fresh fruit. The sheets, pillowcases, bedspread and towels were all immaculately clean and fresh. The staff, helpful and friendly and definitely a hotel I would be happy to stay in again. The hotel is situated very close to the Collosium (less than 10min walk away) and apart from the Vatican all the other major sites are about a 15-20 min walk from the hotel. We are not exactly spring chickens but we managed to walk to the vatican (around 40 min walk) and back again. But for those who can't face it a No.40 bus will get you there but depending on the traffic it could still take around 30 minutes. We booked through Hotels.com and paid 109 euros per night. Be aware Rome has just introduced a City Tax so you will also need to pay 2 euros per person per night. Hotel staff very friendly and reception staff very very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: Travel G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and were disappointed with it. There was black mold on the ceiling of the 3rd floor. (Which is unsanitary and puts all of our health at risk) I was shocked when I noticed that and will ask my sister to post pictures of it later. The first room they put us did not have blankets. It was freezing the first night and the heater took 10 hours to start working. The mattresses made my back hurt and the curtains and spreads looked like they were 20 years old. We paid for a Room with a terrace and our "terrace" was filled with what looked like air conditioning equipment. The elevator was small and started making strange noises the day before we left. The location is amazing. The metro is a 5 minute walk from the hotel and buses are about a 10 minute walk from the hotels. The hotel is located in a historic district of Rome. Julius Caesar was born 5 minutes from the hotel. There is an amazing cultural and artistic life in the area. We found an amazing Book and Wine Bar called Libro di Vino two minutes from the property. The Colosseum is about a 15 minute walk from the hotel For the most part the staff was accommodating, although there were times that some were not. Rosa, Mohammad and the night clerk were very helpful. I had arranged with Rosa for a discount on my room price and when we were checked out, they tried not to give it to us...even though they had the email right in front of them. When we switched rooms, we asked that our bags be moved. Instead of one of the guys moving our heavy luggage, the maid did it. I was NOT impressed. She was tiny and our bags were heavy. She had to carry them down a steep flight of stairs (We asked for them to be moved so that we would not hurt ourselves coming down the stairs.) The price is too much for what you are offered in the hotel. There is a hostel down the road, Ostello Marello that was a fraction of the price. (An American we met there stayed in this Hostel. It was nicer than what we had by far!) The Hostel is run by nuns. I would suggest that or another Hotel over Hotel Grifo. 3 of us stayed in the Hotel over this trip. NONE of us EVER want to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Service?????????”
Reviews.Author: eyy
Reviews.Content: Quite pricey for this small room. Old with mismatched beddings and moldy smell. Old rugs with broken closet. Fuzzy TV. Elevator is also very small which is very hard when you have big luggages. Only one hotel personnel would assist you. Although Rosa (hotel personnel) is very accomodating and helpful, I don't think this hotel has something else to offer. Some restaurants nearby but tends to be noisy during at nighttime. Accessibility is so-so. the hotel location is about 20 minutes walk to Colloseo. should you wish to go around and see Rome ,you can take the Metro which is few minutes walk from the hotel. From the airport, you can take a group shuttle to your hotel and will cost you less than 50 euro but it would take you more than an hour to get to your hotel. Because the driver need to drop off passengers to different hotels. If you are two persons and wished to take the Leonardo Express from the airport to Termini station then transfer to a cab to this hotel, it will cost you practically the same. Hotel is about 30 kilometers from the airport. Since we need to leave early from the hotel to the airport for our next destination, we have asked their personnel to arrange airport transfer solely for us. For regular hours charges is 50 euro and 70 euro for (10pm-7am) service. When we were checking out, all lights at the reception area were turned off, It was very dark,we can only see the light of their pc. The reception clerk didn't bother to open the lights much more didn't even bother to offer us a seat while waiting for our ride. He just took our key and leave us at the reception area without even speaking to us. Well, maybe he is still sleepy. He only showed up again when our driver knocked. He didn't say a word. That's what you call service?

Reviews.Title: “a lot of euros for a tiny room”
Reviews.Author: Dan G
Reviews.Content: On an alley that is used as a freeway, it's noisy and dangerous to walk the area. The room they put us in overlooked the street on the main floor and when we complained about the noise, that goes on ALL night, they would not move us. You will have to close the windows and turn the AC all the way up to go to sleep. The rooms are tiny and bathrooms are tiny. You'll be lucky if you don't drop anything in the shower because you wont be able to bend over to pick it up. It will be all you can do to turn around without having your arm adjust the hot water flow. Ours had a broken mirror and a toilet flushing mechanism only the "Beverly Hillbillies" would be proud of. Breakfast was OK, but nothing to boast about. Doesn't anyone put fruit out anymore? The bar was silly and there was NO safe in the room we stayed in. The price was high for what you got but they would subtract 8% if you paid in cash.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: educ8tor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Grifo during our two week trip to Italy for the first time! We arrived and were immediately assigned a room but were moved without hesitation when we discovered our air conditioner was not working. We were very appreciative of the assistance as we were not used to the kind of humidity and heat! Our newly assigned room was on the top floor of the main building and while the hotel does offer a small elevator, we chose to take the twisting, winding stairs up to the top for the experience! It was fun! A little scary on the way down, but fun! The breakfast in the morning is exactly what you would want before a long day of sightseeing. They offered a nice variety and we always left full and satisfied. Everyone we encountered at the front desk was so kind and helpful. They were always genuinely interested in our day and wanting to know how we were enjoying the city. They always suggested the best restaurants and the best spots to have some gelato. We asked a ton of questions, always asked for directions and never once did they make us feel like we were a bother. This is a cute little hotel in a perfect location. Surrounded by tons of restaurants and within walking distance of some pretty amazing sights. You can't go wrong staying at the Hotel Grifo!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Little Hotel on a Busy Little Alley”
Reviews.Author: Brian S
Reviews.Content: To get a truly wonderful experience of The Eternal City, try the Hotel Grifo. A short walking distance from the Cavour metro station, the small, multi-story Hotel is sandwiched between similarly-sized buildings. The Hotel is on a narrow street that bustles with commuters in the morning and with walkers in the evening. Our room was a couple of levels above the street, so it was fun watching them get to work. As with every hotel we stayed at in Italy, with operable windows are very well insulated, so if you close them, you won't hear anything outside. The room and bathroom were small but clean. The staff was excellent and most helpful. A short walking distance to many sites!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: gzajay
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at Hotel Grifo after reading excellent reveiews on TripAdvisor. They turned out to be true! The service was fantastic, perhaps the best at any hotel we've been to. The front desk staff were friendly, offered tips and suggestions, remembered our names and were generally always welcoming. The room was small (like any other in the city), but we comfortably stayed in a triple room. the beds were very small though; slightly smaller than a (USA) twin size. There wasn't much of a view, but the terrace was nice. Breakfast was good with a selection of cereal, bread, wonderful croissants and jams.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Erika G
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 enjoyed the quad room with the terrace (shared terrace but we were the only ones using it). We got a "feel for Rome" as the hotel is not a North American style hotel. It is in a quite area but not far from anything. We had a problem with our A/C during our stay and it was hard to get a repair man due to big vacation time in Rome. Hotel Grifo provided us with 2 fans and they also provide some compensation - the nights cooled down so it was bearable. Breakfast was sufficient, only suggestion would be to have some fruit. Staff were wonderful and helped with suggestions. We would stay there again & recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: tornadomom
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself, our 18 year-old daughter and her best friend stayed at the Hotel Grifo for three nights in July 2011. It was a great hotel. Very clean and the staff was very helpful. It had a beautiful garden rooftop that was lovely. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location”
Reviews.Author: flowerchick66
Reviews.Content: Hotel Grifo was a nice, comfortable, clean & reasonably priced place to stay in Rome. The location is great, and 10 min walk to Colosseum. The hotel is on a quiet street in Rome, with several excellent restaurants within a two block radius. The showers are a little dinky as other people commented on, but after three weeks in Italy, they seemed normal!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Travelleigh
Reviews.Content: We traveled for about 3 weeks in Europe as a family of 4 - we have 2 adult children so we needed space for 4 adults. Rome was our third stop, and we stayed there 5 days. A friend recommended Hotel Grifo because of location and helpful staff. We didn't research the hotel at all and went on our friend's recommendation. We emailed the hotel in advance to be sure they could accommodate our need for an ensuite room with space for 4 adults, preferably at least one double with two twin beds. We were informed there was such a room. When we arrived, I, the mother, was struck by the dowdiness and smallness of the room. I was depressed after some of the places we had stayed that were actually less expensive and much nicer. My family said the room is clean, it has the bathroom in the room, the beds were fine - one queen and two singles, and all seemed to be in working order. Once we went out and found so much within walking distance, the earlier and negative impression went away. We realized the location was incredible. We found too that the hotel staff were indeed friendly and very helpful. We were given a map several times with the places we wanted to go highlighted. Our Vatican tour was booked through the hotel in advance of our stay. We were picked up at the hotel door and delivered back as described in an email to us from the hotel. The van for the Vatican tour was late arriving, but the person at the hotel desk sensed our concern and called the tour company to be sure that we were not forgotten. The breakfast was quite adequate - meats, eggs, yogurts, bread choices, cereals, juices, and more. I especially loved the ability to have plenty of coffee. WIFI didn't reach our room on the 2nd floor but we used it in the lobby/breakfast/bar areas during the day or evenings. It was a hike to go up and down the stairs but there is an elevator available. When we were ready to leave, the hotel staff arranged our taxi to Ciampino Airport and told us the approximate cost. That was the only taxi we used while in Rome. Otherwise, we found train and subway and walking as adequate ways to get around Rome. We did get a ROMA pass, which seemed to be a good deal for us. We ventured to Naples and Pompeii for a day while staying in Rome. One last thing -try the restaurants noted on the hotel website. We went to two of them and both were great. We enjoyed our time in Rome and would book the Hotel Grifo again.

Reviews.Title: “Family room is a terrific value”
Reviews.Author: janet2buns
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Rome with our 20 year old son this spring. As there were three of us it was difficult to find a room big enough to accommodate all of us in such an expensive city as Rome. We were very satisfied with the family room at Hotel Grifo. It is actually two rooms with the bathroom across the hallway. This gave all of us some much needed privacy, and the bathroom really wasn't a problem since it is not shared with any other guests. Unfortunately the bathtub area ceiling was mildewed, but it should be easy to fix up. We also had a very nice balcony which was perfect for evening relaxation. The location is excellent and central. This is certainly a basic hotel, nothing fancy, but it suited our purpose very well.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located near the sites that are a "must see" in Rome...”
Reviews.Author: Teresa-MTML
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located near the sites that are a "must see" in Rome. We walked from the hotel most of the time around the area and there's a lot of restaurants to choose from, and little stores where you can get water much cheaper and miscellaneous things we need.   When you get to the hotel early, you can store your luggages along with other guests, since there's someone at the front desk. Our room is on the second floor and the window opens up to the street. I personally enjoyed the wide window because I stick my head out and watch the people passing by, and some have a very nice and friendly smile while waiving at me.   We have no complaints with our room, it was basic but clean with two twin beds, one pillow per person and decent size bathroom but the shower is small. Make sure you bring all toiletries, since what they have is an all in one shampoo and body wash in the shower area, which I didn't mind using. It’s the same thing when we were in France. The sheets were clean and our room was well taken care off when we were out and about. We had free breakfast, which I've forgotten about after I booked the hotel, but it was nice have it to get our day started. They have bread (croissant is what I've been eating at breakfast while I was there), cheese, butter, juice, coffee, and there's ham (cold meats) for breakfast. The gentlemen in the front desk was nice enough to let us get our quick breakfast though we were running late, if I remember it correctly it was from 8am-10am. The girl that was taking care of the tables was wonderful to talk to and she's very nice. The Wi-Fi access cuts in and out and we had some issues with it (well just don't expect too much with Wi-Fi connection), a couple of times we had to ask for help since we couldn't connect. Nevertheless, we already expected that some of the place where we’re staying will have issues with Wi-Fi connection, but they'll let you use their computer at the lobby if you really need to. In the evening, you'll have to ring the bell to get someone to open the main door to get in and I didn't have any issues.   The top floor was overlooking some of the streets and some neighboring buildings and it was just beautiful. When I booked this hotel, I knew after I drop my luggage in the room I had to see it! I've spent some mornings and evenings at the rooftop with a glass of wine and a book to read, it depends with the person… I personally like and appreciate the view.   The hotel staff was friendly and professional and helped us with what we need such as direction, which bus to take, where to dine and hours, and we also purchased a "Roma pass" worth 25euros at the hotel. We were able to use this card to skip long lines and we didn't pay any entrance fee at the Colloseum and Castel Sant' Angelo and didn't have any trouble using it. But we missed other major sites where we can use the card; make sure to check out the sites listed in the packet and hours of operation. We were able to use this card for bus rides as well (we either show our card to the bus driver or scan), and according to the packet you can get discounts when you have the pass to show but we didn't get a chance to try. We walked to the Colloseum, Roman forum was just nearby, St. Maria Marggiore, other sites and around the area for sightseeing. Other days we took the bus from Via Nazionale to get to Piazza San Pietro, and to Fontana de Trevi. I walked around in the daytime to just check out the some of the little streets and I had no issues finding my way back, though I had no idea where I was since I just kept walking around and used the map when I was ready to go back. For sure, I picked up a cone of gelato then continue my walk, and later on got back to my hotel. The front desk personnel told me about this café is just a step away from the hotel, went there and they serve some snacks while I have my glass of wine. But that was around 5pm where they are getting ready for dinner, so maybe snacks doesn't always come with the drink for free. We were lucky when we were in Italy, it was the Republic holiday so there's a lot going on.   So, overall the hotel is in a great location, basic room but clean, small shower, staffs are friendly, helpful and professional, and I wouldn't mind staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad as it could be”
Reviews.Author: Drnadin
Reviews.Content: Nice appartments in the separate building. No problems except shower.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: mdwebb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in a quad room /w balcony in May 2011. The room was spacious enough for the 4 of us (all women, ages 30-50). Bathroom a little small, but adequate. We had lovely views from the balcony and had the opportunity to eat lunch there one afternoon. The location could not be beat. We were just off Cavour near the Coliseum. There were numerous restuarants and local shops right on our street. We had breakfast included in our rate. They had cold cuts, yogurt and cereal. Not spectacular, but it started us off for the day.

Reviews.Title: “It was a great little place with a geat location and staff!”
Reviews.Author: Muchmoretodo
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night but I would stay again for sure! Excellent staff, (Rosa) nice entry, clean rooms and a great morning breakfast. The room we had was small but there are larger rooms- besides we did it go there to stay in the room. The common balcony was really quaint and nice and charming. The best thing was location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: zil129
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on the reviews. Was looking for something affordable, comfortable and safe in Rome. This was it. While the rooms aren't 4 star, they are comfortable. We also had a balcony overlooking the street, which was wonderful to sip some wine and relax. The hotel is centrally located to most attractions. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location, lots of activity at your doorstep!”
Reviews.Author: brodyman5
Reviews.Content: Stayed on third floor in a comfortable room with a tub. Room was quiet but nothing fancy. We were offered a room on the 5th floor with access to a rooftop balcony. That was cool. Great view of other upper level dwellers. Breakfast was good with yogurt and good meats. Staff was fluent in English and very accommodating. They set up a restaurant reservation and transportation to the airport. Metro is a block away and lots of good restaurants nearby. A bit dated and not fancy but location makes up for deficiencies. Computer did not work but was able to plug in laptop for internet. Discount for cash. Good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money at a superb location!”
Reviews.Author: lasse1980
Reviews.Content: Friendly and serviceminded staff - their english is good. Rooms are pretty alright. Old and small, but suited our needs. Biggest advantage is the location and price. Excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, friendly staff, would return.”
Reviews.Author: Pats3689
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights to start our week-long trip in Italy. The staff at the desk was always friendly and helpful with our many questions. Our room was the largest of our trip, with a fully functioning A/C unit. We never had any issue with street noise. The bed was a bit stiff. Unfortunately, we discovered this in all 3 hotels during our trip, so we assumed it was par for the course in Italy. Breakfast was ok, and also ended up being on par with the other hotels. It was good, nothing great though. The shower stall was also a bit tight (i'm slightly smaller than "Average"), again something we discovered in all of our hotels. Location wise, we were just minutes from the Colosseum and Ancient Rome. The neighborhood had plenty of charm and character. Many local restaurants and gelatterias to chose from. We never had any issue with street noise, and we always felt safe walking around. The Metro was also only a few steps away. For the price and location, the value was definitely there. We were pleased with our stay and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a hub when sightseeing Rome”
Reviews.Author: FloridaTravelers1418
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I traveled to Italy (Rome, Naples and Sorrento) and stayed at the Hotel Grifo during our Rome stay. We had read reviews of many hotels before selecting Hotel Grifo and I think this research helped us understand that our room would be smaller and the hotel a bit different from a US hotel. With that being said, we really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Grifo. The staff was extremely helpful in recommending restaurants and confirming our walking path for the day. The location is great for those wanting to walk or use the bus to many sites. As other reviews have stated, our room was small (including a very small shower) but it was always very clean and comfortable. We were even able to use the WiFi from our room. The breakfast was also small but for us it was a great start to the day (especially with the friendly breakfast attendant Angela). For us, Rome was all about the sightseeing and having a safe and comfortable home base where we could utilize the staff for directions and advice -- and we received all that in Hotel Grifo.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 3 star hotel..”
Reviews.Author: Snowy82
Reviews.Content: Toilet was used & unflushed prior to us arriving in the room !! Also the stairwell had no lights working making the steps very dangerous at night - we asked for these to be fixed on our first day & 3 days later they were still not working. Reception staff forgot to arrange an airport pickup so we had to get the train & when we arrived there was no help regarding places to go & how best to get around the city. There is no welcome pack or any info in the room not even any dialing numbers for reception.Breakfast area is not big enough to accomodate the guests so we were standing around waiting for people to finish & we never once saw the bar area open. The location is good however there are hotels nearby of a higher star rating for the same price. Would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My mother always said "If you can't say anything nice................"”
Reviews.Author: slyboy54
Reviews.Content: But on this occasion - small rooms, even smaller bathroom (couldn't turn around in the shower), breakfast not worth having and to top it all off we had money stolen from our room. My wife left her purse in room for 15 mins and when we came back $400 had been taken. How do we know this... we had just counted our money as we were leaving that day. Only good thing is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Good compromise between location, service, price, and amenities”
Reviews.Author: 83Stuart
Reviews.Content: Hotel Grifo has two important things going for it. First, it's in a terrific location. The Colosseum and the ticket office to the Palatine Hill-Forum are about five blocks due south, while the Cavour metro station is even closer to the east (one stop to Termini and a transfer to Line A, which services the Vatican in one direction (six stops) and San Giovanni in Laterano in the other direction (three stops)), so it's a good base from which to explore room on foot. Via del Boschetto is not a main street, so the area generally is quiet (we had no trouble sleeping in rooms 33 and 34 which are on the corner of del Boschetto and a small dead-end alley). Second, the staff at reception could not be friendlier and more helpful (thanks to Luigi, Alessandro, and Rosa). They provided us a map upon arrival and dispensed helpful advice on many occasions, often going on-line to look up opening/closing times, ticket costs and availability, etc. Communication beforehand via e-mail was excellent; check-in and check-out were effortless (credit cards are accepted but a discout is given if paying cash). The amenities are pretty straightforward. The rooms are spartanly furnished. Our family of five (children ages 13, 11, and 5) occupied 33, which is a quadruple with a large bathroom (tub with "telephone" showerhead), and 34, which is a double with a smaller bathroom (shower stall only). Beds were made each day and towels changed. I am of average height and I found our double bed a bit short. The TV has plenty of Italian channels, but no international ones that we could find. Breakfast was a weak spot. The area is small with only a handful of tables, so it got crowded quickly and people had to overflow into the bar area. The selection was adequate for a short stay (three kinds of cereal; sliced ham, turkey, and cheese; rolls and croissants; small yoghurts; coffee, hot milk, and hot water; orange juice). There is one computer terminal in the bar area (3 euros/hour for internet access). This is not a hotel for those seeking charm or romance in their accommodations, but it is a very functional place as a base for seeing Rome and you couldn't find a better reception staff at any price.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: biscuitina
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel's annexe - a small apartment for 2 nights. 'Shabby chic' would be a polite way to describe it and it was a bit of a walk from the main hotel - so it won't suit some people. For example, it would be a long walk for breakfast if it was raining. But for us there was beautiful sunshine so we enjoyed the little walk. Overall we really enjoyed our stay and found the staff friendly and very helpful with directions, transport advice, leaving our luggage etc. Breakfast was fine. Great location - lots of little restaurants and bars nearby and we started to feel at home in the area very quickly. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint”
Reviews.Author: KVP7458
Reviews.Content: We arrived and the staff was extremely friendly. We had arrived in Rome by plane around 9:30am and arrived at the hotel around 11am. The check-in time is not until the afternoon and they allowed us to check-in, drop off our bags, and wash up. This was gladly appreciated after 15 hours of travel time. Also, I would like to compliment the hotel on their complimentary breakfast. The coffee was great and they always accomodated us when we were early or late. The breakfast was enough to hold us over until lunch. Our linens were always fresh everyday. However, the beds are not to be desired but we don't stay in our beds very long on vacation. We get up in the morning and are usually gone all day. They have a few restuarants right around the corner that have the best pizza and customer service. It also is 2 blocks from the Coloseum and metro. They also have a change box down the street that gave us great rates when exchanging cash for euro which I recommend cause the commercial ones will give horrible exchange rates and charge commission. The last day the clerk called for a taxi for us. It was only 5 euro more than taking the train. We had a wonderful time and a lot of it is do to the great stay at Hotel Grifo. I definitely recommend this hotel as long as you don't care about the extra amendities. The staff was awesome. Oh, they also speak and write great English. I had emailed them a week before our arrival. They emailed me back promptly and understandable.

Reviews.Title: “great location , great staff, rooms are fine”
Reviews.Author: sliderTelaviv
Reviews.Content: this hotel is located not far rome's major sites . and lies in a quiet street with lots of resurants near. the staff was very helpfull and friendly, they did everything they could in order to make our stay enjoyable. the rooms are clean and comfortable , though it's recomend to ask in advance rooms with toilet rooms, some rooms have joined bathrooms. because we where 3 we recieved a great room a "penthouse" with a great balcony. the balcony was the best feature of the room. the breakfast was suffciant. regarding the price the hotel is ok, slightly expensive, but it's rome. the hotel for some fee grants you premision to park the car in nearby streets. even though we payed for the parking we got a ticket. don't use a car in rome

Reviews.Title: “Great location - awesome value for money”
Reviews.Author: beewhy
Reviews.Content: Location is great. you can walk to almost everywhere, and it's very close to public transportation so getting to and from the airport is easy. Price is unbeatable for a comfortable - clean place. Double-glass window provided very good sound insulation - very useful, since it can get noisy at night. Breakfast was ok for us (but expect continental style). The only downside was the size of the sowe cubicle: very minimum. We managed, but if you are average-to-big sized, it can get uncomfortable. Wi fi signal did not reach every room, but it was free!! (and there is always the reception if you got unlucky trying to get a signal) I would go back to this hotel anytime

Reviews.Title: “Best value on my trip to Europe”
Reviews.Author: jediblueman
Reviews.Content: For the price this hotel was great and included breakfast and the breakfast was quite nice for a complimentary breakfast. Also had a computer to use in lobby (for small fee). Staff was very friendly and the lobby is nice and pretty. My room was on top floor which was weird because last set of stairs after elevator was outside but gave us sort of a private patio so that was neat. Kind of weird that you leave the key at the hotel and they hand it to you every time you come in...no real security behind this but it is such a small place they get to know you. I was supposedly getting a room with a shower in a separate room but to my surprise I got one in my room for same price. Fantastic location near Colloseum.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, poor rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ChantelAdcock
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and many of them spoke english very well. The room and shower left much to be desired by American standards (large people could not shower here). Great location near lots of restaurants and shopping, very close to the Collisum. Breakfast Buffett left much to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Well Run, Good Facilities, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Bathin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Grifo in July '09 and '10. It has become our hotel of choice. I cannot understand the damning reviews, which is why I have written this belated review. The Grifo really tries. It has an old world politeness and attention to detail The hotel is modest, welcoming and comfortable. In '09 we had a room with a balcony; it was lovely. We assumed this was standard, but it is a little extra. I have had better breakfasts at twice the price, but the coffee was excellent; the cereal could have been better. The breakfast waitress from Romania was the friendliest and most helpful I have come across. Rome has been a favourite destination for over 30 years; I have stayed in many of its hotels. Few can match the Grifo for its combination of location, value and facilities. In my home town, Aberdeen, you could expect to pay more for a lot less. There are many good eating places in the vicinity. The number of excellent notices don't lie. This hotel has a personal touch and goes out of its way to help the traveller and make a holiday memorable. Which is why we have booked again for July 2011 (this time with a balcony).

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for anything better”
Reviews.Author: trucky941
Reviews.Content: Place was clean, close to all and the staff was extreamly helpful and nice! Thank you for making mine and my friend's first time to Rome an amazing one! I would stay here again in a second!

Reviews.Title: “Cold room, cold Rome”
Reviews.Author: Olesya30
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the Grifo hotel. The only things which were really good : the location, just few minutes from the Colosseum and from the metro stop Cavour 2) the staff, extremely helpful and kind. Breakfast was very poor, the breakfast room very tiny, we could barely move and they were just few tables. The rooms were very tiny too and the walls dirty with several stains. The room was very cold because instead of carpet there were tiles. The view from our room was just awful. The bathroom was small, the shower cabin was made just for slim people, otherwise you could barely manage to enter. The water was cool the first 5 minutes. Then, the air conditioning, while trying to warm the room made a huge noise, which disturbed our sleep by night, so we had to turn it off. For that price, I would never dare to return there again.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service!”
Reviews.Author: mishgolden
Reviews.Content: Concierge Alessandro constantly went out of his way to be incredibly helpful. His knowledgeable (and polite and cheerful) guidance about sightseeing is the best a tourist could ever ask for! The hotel is a great value! It's also very close to the Coliseum and the forum, as well as to bus lines that go to the train station and to much of the rest of sightseer's Roma. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Con4Jeff
Reviews.Content: After spending several hours and reviewing several hotels in Rome for the time we were staying, I chose the Hotel Grifo and glad I did. It was convenient to all of the ruins and sites of Central Rome. Most of all, the staff were all very kind and willing to help us. Our trip was delayed one day because of the weather here in the states. When we called the hotel, they were understanding and told us it was no problem. They had air conditioning for summer and heat for the winter. They also had the nicest lani outside of our room that opened up and somewhat extended our room. I would recommend this hotel to any one looking for a place to stay in Rome at any time.

Reviews.Title: “i love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: salmaglen
Reviews.Content: I have really loved to stay for 4 simple reason: location, cleanliness, the (maid is pretty )reception always very kind and price: 64 euros a night was a great for an expensive town as rome. Be sure you will see me again next winter.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent location, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Anna_Zak
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Grifo in December 2010, stayed for 8 days - which was a pretty long stay. I have red many positive reviews of this hotel before booking and I didn't make a mistake when decided to book it. Location: just perfect. Next to metro, bus stop, main tourist attractions. There is a supermarket nearby and a lot of small nice restaurants and cafes, as well as various shops. Hotel located on a small quiet street so there is no noise in the nighttime. Also we walked through all Rome by foot and it was always easy to get back to the hotel, either by bus or by metro. Rooms: though they are small, it's not an obstacle for someone who is going to enjoy Rome and not to stay in the hotel for a long time. Enough space to get enough rest. Our room was basic - without shower in the room, but it was ok. It was warm inside the building so it wasn't a problem to walk few steps after a shower to our room. Food: breakfast is really nice, and the morning coffeee...... mmmm, it was so tasty!!!! I still remember the smell of this rich and smooth coffee coming from downstairs to our room - it was just a pleasure to wake up every morning and feel that someone has already made a coffee for you :) Staff: always polite, smiling, helpful, attentive. Ready to help. One negative thing I can mention - in the room next to ours there was a baby which was crying for a long time - for 2 or even 3 hours in a row at night!! It was really impossible to sleep last three nights, I even called our neighbours to offer some help but the lady said: "I apologize, but our baby has a stomach ache and there is nothing we can do". But it really sounded like they didn't even try to do anything. But it is definetely not the hotel's fault, it's just the matter of luck. You never know with whom you will ba sharing the hotel. Overall, I would definetely recommend this hotel to anyone who is going to Rome for a leisure or business trip.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: ekay123
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel to people who are looking for affordable place to stay that is in a good location. You will get what you pay for. Everybody was so friendly and helpful at this hotel. The breakfast was included and it was really good. We could walk everywhere easily without using public transportation. The rooms were small and the building was old, but this is perfectly normal in a historical city like Rome. We knew what to expect and hence were not disappointed at all. When we got the hotel early in the morning, we could check in early (like around 11 am) since we told them that we were coming from the US and would be exhausted after our plane ride. Stay at this hotel if location, affordability are of main concerns to you. The staff is very professional and friendly. The rooms are small and old, the furniture is not the best, but it is what you get for what you pay for. We did not mind it since our room was very clean and our bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very Charming! Cozy, friendly, neighborly and full of surprises!”
Reviews.Author: rtaher
Reviews.Content: Grifo is a very cozy, friendly, clean and well situated hotel few steps from the coloseum. Among the three hotels we stayed at in Italy, Grifo was the best! The hotel is well situated in a very nice and historic neighborhood with restaurrants, pubs and places to visit. It is few steps from the coloseum and worth the extra you would pay in being a little further from the train station. It has a personal touch and you can see it in the care given to the place. The people at the reception are very very friendly and helpful! Last, it has interesting surprises, like a terrace in some of the rooms that makes you feel just at home!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: b_is_for_becca
Reviews.Content: We had a great four days staying at the apartment which is just up the road from the hotel, the hotel has got two great plus points, the location and the staff, the main gentleman Alassandro in particular was always on hand for tips and advice to make the most of Rome, in particular eating out. The apartment was adaquate and quirky, it's in a old cobbled street which has a violin maker opposite and a artist underneth, there is also a busy club next door so it was noisy at night. All this didn't effect our stay just a reminder that we were staying in a busy part of the city. If you want a central, cost friendly staff in Rome Grifo should be on your list .

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: hanleycl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Grifo in November 2010. As many other travelers have noted, the service is outstanding. The location is also wonderful - very close to the Colosseum, and within walking distance to many of the top sites of Rome. The breakfast buffet gets you ready for a day of sightseeing, and if you have any questions, the staff is very accommodating. I would recommend making sure that you bring earplugs, however, as the central location ensures that there is always foot and car traffic right outside your windows. Overall we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: folkart-films
Reviews.Content: We spent 9 nights at Hotel Grifo in mid November/10. We chose it partly for location and partly based on reviews on this and other travel sites. We initially booked for 5 nights, with a “wait and see” attitude for the final few days. Our stay at Grifo was one of the best hotel experiences we've had. Apart from the superb location (5 minute walk to the Colosseum...you can actually see the top of it from the roof), Grifo can boast of clean, comfortable rooms, with air conditioning, TV and free wifi.(at least on the first two floors...signal strength dies on 3 and 4.) We had a private bathroom and balcony for the first 5 days, then moved to two other rooms for the last four nights (our fault for not booking ahead. The hotel did a great job accommodating us.), and both had access to terrace, and both were as clean and comfortable as the first. The staff was uniformly helpful and friendly. The included breakfast was quite adequate, and a good way to start each day's exploring. With the cute little dining room and 2 rooms to a floor, the hotel had more of a bed and breakfast feel. The front desk was always available for site seeing tips, restaurants and transportation suggestions..there was no language barrier. The neighbourhood was amazing, with lots of everything you could want. I would not hesitate to send a friend or family member to Grifo, and thought it was a wonderful hotel for a fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in an charming location, plus awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: Cristian_Vedovatto
Reviews.Content: We just loved it! We were an extended family group consiting of me and my wife, our little son and my 66 years mom, so we used the "Camera Tripla Familiare" or Triple Family Room (two bedrooms, side-by-side, sharing a balcony and the same bathroom out in the small corridor). First we were worried about it, but everything went 100%. The balcony is a beautiful place to rest after the walking day and the shared bathroom is big and there is no problem to use it through out the corridor. The rooms aren't that big, but are exactly what we could expect for an old historical building situated in the midle of the historical center of Rome. The breackfest is enought and the staff is awesome friendly. Really good people willing to give you all the assistence you may need. And the hotel location... oh man. We chosse this hotel because it is located in a position that would allow us to walk to every major site in the historical Rome, plus a fair price for a family group. However, when we reached there, we discovered that the neighborhood where it is inserted is another bonus for the traveler. We aren't willing to go for a "nightlife trip" due to our kid and my mom, but the streets surrounding the hotel have such a bohemian air, filled with small shops, restaurants, enotecas and with young people walking, dirnking and chatting all around, that we could not avoid to walk all nights around there, aimless, stoping to drink some wine or beer after the dinner and taste this special air. We shared this feelings with one of the staff members in the moment of our checkout, and he told us that he has grown up in those streets and that was a bad neighborhood, with prostitutes and thiefs all around. But the government cleaned it up years ago and so it became a bohemian area. We noticed the safety of the streets at night and he explained that the neighborhood has many police stations all around. Asked why, he told us that it is because Berlusconi's house is situated near to the end of the hotel street. We walked there and could not figured exactly which one is it, but we think it was the one with high fences, aprox 500 meters up the street, in another street to the left. Anyway, besides the central location, the fair price, the special staff, the area surrounding the hotel is an attraction itself. We strongly recomend it for romantic couples of any age. In fact, our next trip to Italy will be made only by me and my wife this time (without the kid), and we will stay exactly in this hotel again. It really worths the stay! We really have enjoyed it!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money and central location with friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: Romefan088
Reviews.Content: Really nice and friendly small hotell in the centre of Rome. Reception speaks good english and are willig to assist you in any way possible. Priceworthy!

Reviews.Title: “We love Rome and enjoyed our stay at Hotel Grifo”
Reviews.Author: curioustotravel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our week stay at Hotel Grifo in Rome, Italy. Our room (with an inside full bathroom and a shower) is clean and big enough to accommodate two people. It has a comfortable bed, a desk with a television, two corner tables, a small refrigerator, a large cabinet to hang and store your clothes, and a telephone. However, the size of the shower does not provide a normal size person the room to move around and/or bend while the sliding door is closed (I was careful not to drop my bath soap). Also, I accidentally bumped into the water shower handle and unknowingly changed the water temperature. When taking a shower I learned to brace myself and gingerly shift my weight because the floor math could easily slide underneath my feet. From what we’ve seen the hallway or outside bathrooms have bigger utility areas. On the positive side, Hotel Grifo is within walking distance to places of interests, the Cavour subway station and Termini train station, grocery stores, restaurants and shops. The hotel only serves breakfasts at no additional cost to hotel guests. Breakfasts included pastries, bread and toasts, cereals, hams, cheese tea, coffee, milk, fruits yogurt and more. The wait staffs are courteous, pleasant and friendly. The biggest asset of the hotel is the reception staffs (Alessandro, Rosa, Luigi and a young fellow I failed to get his name). These four individuals went out of their way to help hotel guests. They made our stay at Hotel Grifo gratifying. However, there is another fellow who is mature and he mostly works in the reception area during latter part of the evening until 8:00 in the morning. On several occasions, this mature fellow was not nice to my wife. For obvious reason, he even told her not to use the desktop PC, which is located in the room next to the reception area, between midnight and 7:30 in the morning. On our check out day, my wife inquired the other reception staff about the availability of desktop PC. She was told that it is available to guests day and night. Will we stay again at Hotel Grifo? The answer is a resounding YES. The location is great! The streets around the hotel are quiet and pedestrian friendly. And thanks to Alessandro, Rosa, Luigi and the young fellow. Review written by Pat and Chito

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel! Verry friendly stuff and good location.”
Reviews.Author: Flake_24
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. A verry good location! Everything was near by and you can walk to the most touristic atractions. Around the hotels are a lot of nice restaurants and small shops. The stuff was verry friendly and helpful. And also the breakfast was good. So i can realy recoment this hotel to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: chrystelle76
Reviews.Content: We wanted to thank you for your kindness, your perfect french and all the good tips given to us to avoid lines!!!! We had a GREAT time in Rome and you don't lie when you say you're near everything!!! We've been walking around for 1 week!! Room was perfect as well as breakfast! We'll come back or friends of ours, for sure!!!! thanks a lot!!! Chris and Tchig from Belgium, Liège

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great people”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesJanfran
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed warmly, pleasantly surprised to get a little terrace off our little room, and directed to the best nearby restaurant (Taverna Marin). It has an elevator, breakfast room, roof terrace, bar off the lobby, and friendly staff. Five minute easy walk to the colloseum. For an inexpensive hotel (for Rome) in a walkable, central area, it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “3-star hotel at 4-star price”
Reviews.Author: jmb872
Reviews.Content: We had only one night to stay in Rome, and were looking for a nice clean hotel close to the sites in ancient Rome. This place fit the bill, but had a few drawbacks. Pros: * the front desk staff was very nice and had lots of tips for getting around Rome and making the most of our short time there. they also reserved a private car transfer to the airport for 50 euros. * it's clean. * close to Colosseum, but far enough away that you feel like you're in a real Roman neighborhood away from the tourist hordes. Cons: * way overpriced (150 euros) for what it's worth. i've stayed at a 5-star hotels for the same price. * neighborhood traffic is noisy at night. * ancient lock on the door opens with a skeleton key. doesn't feel very secure. * toilet operates strangely, shower door difficult to close. * thin walls - you can hear other guests walking up and down the stairs. We left early in the morning, so we didn't get to enjoy the breakfast. Maybe that would have made up for the other shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTICO, FANTASTICO, FANTASTICO!”
Reviews.Author: lullielou
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 5 days in beautiful Rome. After looking for a long time on travel advisor I found this little Gem in the heart of Rome. This was a trip with myself , my mother and 15 year old daughter thet was within our budget.
