We chose the Family triple room because my Mum is a light sleeper and this meant she had a room on her own but we shared the terrace which we sat and had Tea and relaxed after many of hours walking.The family triple is a double /twin room and single room next door sharing a lovely bathroom with shower AND bath just a few steps up the corridor (which was just for our use only). We knew this before we arrived so knew exactly what to expect. Beds really comfortable and rooms kept clean by lovely cleaners. Breakfast was really good. Ham, Turkey, Cheese , Rolls, gorgeous Coissants , yoghurts, cereals, coffee Tea, and jucies.The Hotel is so central to everything the only transport we got was the number 40 to the Vatican Museum and the Metro to Ostia Antica, which is amazing (do watch for pick pockets on Metro , my MUm had a lucky escape). The Colosseum is literally a street away. The staff at this hotel are truly exceptional, they will go out of their way to help you , nothing seemed too much to ask. Alessandro was really helpful we went to some places that we didn't even think about going to , he advised us of the best times to visit , he advised us of the Baslica St Paulo just one stop off the Metro after visiting Ostia Antica. Listen to him! We did contemplate not purchasing the ROMA PASS because we weren't sure we would get total value from the cost (25 Euro), But believe me it is well worth it with the public transport included and literally missing all the que's -Roma Pass holders use a different line, must a have saved us 2 hours queing in total at the Forum and the Colosseum. Would go back tomorrow if I had the opportunity (and my coin thrown into the Trevi Fountain brings be back there) and this is the same for my Mum and daughter, coming from a hormonal teenager this is saying something :0)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Lisa8383
Reviews.Content: The reception staff are so helpful at this hotel. They have great advice about where to eat and how to get the most out of your stay in Rome providing you with helpful tips. The hotel has a nice Terrace where you can sit and have a drink while looking over some of the surrounding rooftops. Its very clean and pretty central to most site seeing activities in Rome. You just walk down the road to get to the Coloseum. Great hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, great location, good price, but small rooms, echoey halls”
Reviews.Author: NightOwl34
Reviews.Content: I really liked it here. The location is superb, on a quite sidestreet, 10-15 mins pleasant walk through charming sidestreets to the Colosseum. Loads of well-priced, popular restaurants in the vicinity, no obvious tourist traps. Feels perfectly safe after dark. This all means you can spend a full day at Colosseum, Palatine Hill, Forum, etc, and walk leisurely back to the hotel via a restaurant without using any public transport, taxis, etc. This is what you want on holiday! It took us about half an hour to walk from Termini Station (which is about our limit wheeling suitcases.) It's probably 10-15 mins walk to either Cavour or Colloseo metro stations, which is why we didn't use the metro with this hotel. Negative points - small rooms. (Bear in mind at this price, you either get small rooms or a less desirable neighbourhood, with budget hotels in cities.) Shower room was down the hallway, which was inconvenient, even though was a nice size and only used by ourselves. Shower not always hot when expected. Also the the tiled floors and small size of the hotel mean noise travels, especially if other guests are inconsiderate. Service very friendly and helpful. Old fashioned hotel desk, you give them your room key whenever you walk out of hotel, always someone on the desk. Breakfast suprisingly good, and plentiful (self service.) Very clean rooms and public areas. In summary a well-run hotel. NB. A historical fact which may fascinate, stimulate or disappoint, depending on your viewpoint - this property was a brothel 30 years ago.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, very friendly staff and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: GuilleBruxelles
Reviews.Content: This was not my first stay in Hotel Grifo and it will certainly not be the last! The Grifo is a small hotel in a quiet but central location. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are of a good size (for Rome standards) and quite comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Alessandro above all !!!”
Reviews.Author: Inbar_Y
Reviews.Content: We arrived late and got a small room with W/C however the shower was not ensuite. We got the explanation that this the way it is with the basic room and went to sleep disappointed. Next morning asked Alessandro about the possibilities to change the room. He took it seriously, managed to get us another room in the annex (just in front of the hotel - very convenient), he delt with the problem in the most efficient way. The room was perfect. Ensuite w/c and shower included, WIFI worked well. Location is excellent, we walked everywhere even though public transportation is near (metro and buses). Breakfast was nice, many good restaurants around. Piccolo Buco near the Fontana de Trevi is an extraordinary place to eat. Above all, it is Alessandro that makes the Grifo a great place to stay. He was helpful (we got very useful hints that saved us time and money), efficient, intelligent and always prepared to help. Grazie mille Alessandro!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service”
Reviews.Author: jcs23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect spot from which to explore Rome. It's on a side street, an easy walk to the Colliseum and Forum, and not too far from the subway. There are plenty of restaurants nearby for either a quick coffee or dinner. The staff was very helpful, and the breakfast offered delicious croissants. We were in the annex, just across the street (which is all that was available when we booked). Another time, we would choose to stay in the main building, as the wireless internet service did not reach across the street. But the room was clean, quiet and very much met our needs for our two nights in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Truly wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: ORtouring
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel to try and balance price and amenities. The rooms were small which we expected as it is Rome but well maintained. The location is good for access to much of the sites of Rome with good restaurants nearby and the rooftop terrace is a nice place to have a glass of wine or coffee. But the real value in this hotel was the superb staff with special accolades to Alessandro. With only one exception (the night person) everyone was polite, exceedingly helpful about touring and consistently cheerful. Plus the day and early evening crew all spoke English along with several other languages. We would recommend this hotel to anyone trying to maintain some sort of reasonable budget while in Rome and wanting assistance with the daily joys and sorrows of touring a big, unknown city..

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: cecilBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Tried to extend stay at another hotel without success. So found Hotel Grifo in same area. After speaking with Alessandro re. booking a room, I felt very at ease with the choice. I wasn't let down. Right from the word go everything was right. One minor hiccup was stairs . Alessandro quickly realised my difficulty and saw to it that I was able to access a lift. The hotel is small but adequate and super clean The staff was really lovely and most helpful. In an old part of town, but don't be put off by that as there are many good restaurants and attractive shops to keep all the girls happy! Colluseum and other attractions are within walking distance with hop on hop off buses not too far away. Take advice from Alessandro when it comes to tours etc. He knows his business. This man speaks 8 languages so be at ease if from another country!!!!! My husband and I would recommend this hotel without hesitation and would stay there again if the opportunity arose. Thank you Alessandro and your great staff for making our stay in Rome very comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Real rome”
Reviews.Author: plannersteve
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Grifo for 5 days after a two week coach tour.We stayed in many different hotels along the way and I would have to say our best experience was at the Hotel Grifo.We arrived early (11am) but after a quick check a smiling Allesandro was happy to tell us our room was ready.The room was just as we expected to be small,clean and charming.We really liked the fact that we were at the front of the building over looking the street.My wife liked to open the windows and shudders first thing every morning and watch as people in the area were off to work or taking there kids to school. I liked to watch in the evening as everybody was coming home.It gave us a real feel for the every day life of the Roman people.Every morning after a good breakfast I would have a chat with Allesandro and get my weather report or any advice I would need for the day.It was like staying in a village within Rome.The area is full of restaurants,small shops and no one trying to sell you a scarf (if you been to Rome you know what I mean). You are close to many of the major attractions of Rome.There is a metro and bus stop nearby .Having read reviews about the small bathrooms we chose to also have one down the hall.In our room was a toilet,sink ,mirror and space for your morning things .Down a very short hall we had all of the same plus the shower.We had a key for the shower room and it was only for us during our stay. It worked out great for us to get ready at the same time.We used the free internet in the bar area a few times.There is a grocery store down the street where we bought some food and wine and had a late lunch on the terrace one day.Very nice.There is a refridgerator in the room to keep any supplies cold.If one day I come back to Rome,Hotel Grifo will be where I stay .We would like to thank everyone at Hotel Grifo for making our stay a wonderfull experience. The Payne Family Canada

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced, clean, well located with very helpful staff!!”
Reviews.Author: StampsNart
Reviews.Content: Alessandro was a wonderful help. He was on the day shift, just when we needed advice, suggestions and directions. Rosa was also helpful in the evening. Their command of English was more than adequate. Our room was not huge, but plenty big enough to move around in. Hotel has a cosy little eating room for the included breakfast, one of the best we had on our trip. There is a computer in the adjoining bar area for (free) use by guests. Just ask Alessandro for a password. Location was great for walking or catching city busses. We recommend the nearby Carbonara restaurant. I’d go back tomorrow!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “An affordable gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mjb83
Reviews.Content: I've visited Rome before and found this hotel perfect for a comfortable and happy stay. The location is excellent for walking to all the main attractions. Bed and room are typical, but very clean. We stayed in a room on the 4 fourth floor and our window opened out onto a covered garden terrace. The terrace was the perfect place to rest and regroup after walking around the city. Our bathroom was very clean and larger than most, private, but outside our room. This was totally fine for me because the bathroom was ours privately, but if this would bother you ask for an en suite. The staff are very friendly and helpful, especially if this is your first time to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: cvenalott
Reviews.Content: The hotel and room was charming. Very comfortable bed. The staff could not have been more helpful. Very good breakfast. Great location-could walk to most sites. Great terraces.

Reviews.Title: “Central, old part of town, great atmosphere inside and outside the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sydneywoman
Reviews.Content: Our room was small but clean with en suite facilities. The outside street noise was a bit bothersome as was the neighour talking at 6.30am. Breakfast was adequate and simple but no fruit. A couple of blocks easy walk took us to the Colloseo and the Forum and we were about 30 minutes walk to all main attractions. Plenty of drinking and eating places locally in the little cobbled streets and even a small supermarket just up the road. We found Luigi at the front desk to be very helpful and spoke fluent English, although not all staff were the same.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great People”
Reviews.Author: AngelaandTom
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel provided comfortable and most welcoming accomodation during our recent 3 night trip to Rome. It is centrally situated in a picturesque area of narrow cobbled streets and ivy clad terracotta buldings and is only a short distance away from the Cavour Metro Station. Just a short walk around the corner and the Colosseum is in view at the end of the road! Everywhere was spotlessly clean and gave the impression that it was really well cared for. In our case, we had a "basic" room and, although there was en-suite toilet / wash basin, we already knew that the shower would be located a short distance along the corridor, because older buildings are protected by regulations. This presented no problems since it was for our own private use and we had our own key. Each morning, a substantial cold buffet breakfast was served promptly by 7:30am. This included juices, cereals, selections of bread, meat, cheese, yogurt and spreads. A limitless supply of tea and delicious coffee was also on tap. We enjoyed sitting outside on the upstairs terrace, surrounded bu plants and overlooking activity in the street below. The staff were, without exception, delightful - so friendly, helpful and we were sad to say goodbye. We would certainly return to this hotel on any future visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: nadkathegreat
Reviews.Content: Location is absolutely perfect for exploring the historical center of Rome and even night life in Trastevere is just 40 minutes walk (through the illuminated historical center) away. The first time we got there we missed the right turn and in a few seconds ended up looking at Colosseum :) Late evening and night walks are pleasant and pretty safe. Right around the corner were tiny jazz recording studio, musical instrument's workshop and another small workshop where the guy was making copies of ancient roman clothes and armour. There also were qutie a few good restaurants (including cheap but very good Chinese and Indian if you're tired of pasta and pizza) and vinoteca around. Although it isn't by any means some posh hotel the staff were extremely receptieve to our needs and wishes like we were some VIP guests :) It was very helpfull for us that they were also very knowledgeable (Alexandro's tip about Vatican museums saved us hours spent waiting in line) and could speak several languages (including Russian) at least at some basic lavel. Although our room was rather small, it was clean and neat, the bed was very wide and comfortable and there were enough place in wardrobe for all our stuff. It could be a bit noisy - you're not completely safe from noise coming from neighbouring rooms and corridors - but at least the street is absolutelly quiet at night. Overall, we enjoyed our stay, felt that we got what we paid for and then some and therefore would definitely recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great service, great location, great hotel !”
Reviews.Author: PhilippAllerstorfer
Reviews.Content: The Grifo is a very nice hotel with familiar atmosphere and typical italian charm! The perfect experience starts with a very friendly reception team, who speak several languages fluently and anticipate every wish! In our case, the reception manager even offered us a better room without any upcharge. The hotel itself is rather small, with a very familiar atmosphere and built in typical italian style. If you are looking for a real italian accommodation with charm and not a chain hotel, the Grifo is perfect for you. The breakfast is a small buffet with everything you need for a good start of the day: croissants, rolls, toast, cereals, italian cheese and ham, several hot and cold drinks,... again in a very nice and typical italian atmosphere. The location is just great, close to the Colosseo and within walking distance of all the famous sights in Rome. We will definetly come back to Rome and back to the Grifo. I can recommend it to everyone who is looking for a typical italian hotel with very friendly staff. It is a real insider tip.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean B & B and they were always willing to help!”
Reviews.Author: CETTI26
Reviews.Content: This is local to many of the sites but it's alot of walking regardless. I would return during a cooler month...it was in the 90's the entire time my son and I were there. I also recommend if you're running to i.e. sisten chapel --don't wait for the bus just take the taxi so you won't miss it. Rome sightseeing could easily take 5 days but 3-4 would do it. Luigei---you're best---thanks Cettina & Marc from NJ!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Tips from Receptionist”
Reviews.Author: akloefer
Reviews.Content: We spend 1 week in Rom with our kids and found here a small hotel with basis standard. However, the people on the Receptions were absolut amazing and supportiv to visit this famous citiy with kids (7 and 8 years old).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Lizbel0725
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights at the beginning of our Italy trip and 1 night at the end of our trip. The staff was very nice and helpful, the breakfast perfect and the location was perfect also. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: spanish_tourist
Reviews.Content: I went for 3 days to Rom with my husband and we took a lor of time to look for a hotel. We finally booked Hotel Grifo as a recommendation of my cousin, who lived in Rome and knows the area well. And we were not dissappointed. The hotel is located in a quiet street, with metro, supermarket and nice restaurants around. You can walk to the Coliseum & Roman forum (10 minutes) and actually we went on foot to visit most of the places around, except the Vatican where you can go with Bus 40, stop 5 minutes away from the hotel. The room was clean with enough space and we had our own bathroom - there are rooms with shared bathrooms as well. The staff was very friendly and gave advice in several languages: italian, spanish, german, english... The breakfast is nothing special though : american coffe, milk juice, bread & ham, cereals and some croissants. In summary Hotel Grifo is definitely a good place for a few days visit to Roma if you look for a good location and relation between price/service. Mile grazie Hotel Grifo!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and staff, poor facilities and different reality compared to the pictures”
Reviews.Author: oanap
Reviews.Content: Positive things: 1)The location is perfect for visiting Rome, close mainly to Colloseum, but also to every other touristic attraction by foot. Around the hotel you can find several terraces and a very good "gelateria". 2)Alesandro was very welcoming and helpful with all kinds of tips&tricks, he really makes the difference compared to other hotels and makes you feel like anything you could need he could find a solution or an answer. The chamber-maid was also very nice. 3)The breakfast I think it's a good one compared to Italian style with a particular good juice. Not so good things: 1)The temperature in the shower was fluctuating and became cold when you started to feel better after a tiring day (in addition there was no hair-dryer). The sewerage was very poor and you had to close the water during the shower in order not to flood the bathroom. This was the most annoying thing in this hotel. 2)The view was awful (we had a standard double room with bathroom inside, no 31) towards the inside part of the building with warped walls, kitchens from other apartments etc. Fortunately, Rome is much too interesting to spend the time in the room and we kept the curtains closed (though the room was quite gloomy). 3)Because of the limited space for the breakfast, we always had to wait for the staff to bring more of what we wanted to eat. There was always a lady that had to take r bring something in a quite narrow place. The croissants were never enough, especially if you came after 9:30

Reviews.Title: “May Be a Budget Hotel But Still Not Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: alwaysonthego07030
Reviews.Content: We are a young(ish) couple from NYC who have both traveled extensively in Europe but had not spent much time in Italy before. After reading many of the reviews on TA, I booked 4 nights at the Hotel Grifo to conclude a 2-week trip across Italy as we felt confident that Grifo would be similar to the other budget-friendly hotels we had booked for our trip. Unfortunately the hotel left much to be desired & it was clear upon arrival that the website did a great job of marketing the only benefits of the property - such as it's lower out of pocket & proximity to Termini, which was a pretty easy 10-15 minute walk. As soon as we arrived at the hotel, I had a bad feeling. There was just something seedy looking about it that I can't quite describe. Although the man at check-in was more than cordial, I couldn't help but be distracted by the buzzing fluorescent lighting and overwhelming bathroom smell permeating the air. We continued up to our room which was basic but clean. The bathroom was smaller than any other we'd encountered during our 2-week stay in Italy, so much so that the stand-up shower flooded as soon as the water came on. Having arrived in Rome after stays in various properties over in Venice, Florence & Siena - we just couldn't justify 100 Euro/per night for a hotel that felt so creepy & decided it was best to leave. Again, the staff was more than accommodating when we told them we would be checking out the next morning. We moved on to another hotel in the area & couldn't have been happier with our decision. Like anything else, it is all about expectations and what you want from a hotel. I am fine with basic accommodations provided that they are comfortable, clean & safe and unfortunately Grifo did not give fulfill that role for me. I would say this hotel is at the low-end of the "budget" class - somewhere between a roadside motel in the U.S. and a youth hostel abroad.

Reviews.Title: “Poor - but friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: UK-TouristUK
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 nights last weekend. The rate was reasonable, but the room was small and the bathroom and shower smaller still. There was no hot water in the morning and breakfast was poor. The breakfast room is so small, you have to learn over guests to get to the cereal! The staff are very friendly, but I will stay somewhere else next time I go to Rome,

Reviews.Title: “The staff at Grifo is great!”
Reviews.Author: tsveti_sp
Reviews.Content: I like Grifo. Overall our stay was very pleasant and good quality. The walls are a bit too thin and the rooms a bit small. The breakfast was very nice and the location is great!!!

Reviews.Title: “basic base for discovering town”
Reviews.Author: Kardaf
Reviews.Content: This is a basic hotel, that offers for very affordable rates a good base to discover Rome. Our room was small, and decorated with kitch art, but the airco worked perfect, and we had a fridge. The shower was ridicilously small, but it was very much appreciated in the souring hot temperatures in July Rome. Breakfast is basic but OK, and we were lucky to have a good enough signal in our room to log in to the hotel wifi. A big plus is the location: it is close to Roma Termini train station, to the forum, colosseum and the Vittoriano, and surrounded by some very nice restaurants and bars for the evening. It has a rooftop terrace, but it was really too hot to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal quiet location with excellent, well informed staff”
Reviews.Author: stradling
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the location. Luigi and Alesandro on reception recommended excellent restaurants at very reasonable prices. Angela on breakfast was very pleasant and very efficient. It was lovely to be greeted by a happy, smiling face every morning before the slog of sightseeing! Breakfast was more than adequate: juice, cereal, yogurt, bread, cheese, ham, turkey and good HOT coffee!!! The rooftop terrace was a perfect opportunity to meet other guests and get their feedback. Our triple room (I was a mother with an 18 & 20 year old) was clean and the beds were comfortable.and flat screen TV with CNN! (no fridge,but other rooms had one) As a frequent visitor to Rome (twice a year for the last 15 years) I found Hotel Grifo to be the best. What it lacks in ****ratings it compensates with friendly, helpful staff, cleanliness and the quiet location!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with service, never got the room we booked, some positives though”
Reviews.Author: suprgrover
Reviews.Content: I'll sum up my experiences with this hotel quickly; I have very mixed feelings, but cannot get the sour taste from my mouth upon leaving this hotel. Positives: - great location, on a nice street, very close to to the Colosseum, and Cavour subway stop. - room was pretty clean (see note also in negatives), with working AC, and a comfortable bed Negatives: - damp smell in the room we had. I could not find any mould, but my allergies acting up (mould is my only allergy) suggests an issue with our room. Only stayed one night, but if I were to stay longer, I would have had to get another room, or another hotel. Our room also had missing knobs on drawers, etc. This I can forgive with a hotel in this price range in this location to be honest. - no hot water. I had to get a cold shower, as there was no hot water for us. Complained to the desk about it and was told to tell it to the boss the next morning. Our friend in a room upstairs seemed to have it. Hotel was full and no more rooms for us to go to. - *** never got the room we booked, and refused a refund or cheaper rate. This was the big negative for us. We had a triple family room WITH TERRACE booked, and confirmed via an email from Rosa back in the middle of January. When we arrived, a lady at the counter told us there was a 'problem', and they had to give us an 'upgrade.' When we checked out our rooms, we realized there was no terrace for our rooms. Also, the rooms were separated by three floors, when they were supposed to be a triple family unit. I believe the only way this could be considered an 'upgrade' would be if the second bed for the second room was now a double instead of a single. The extra double bed was of no use to us, and we wished for the terrace for our room. Again, was told to 'tell the boss in the morning'. The boss simply told us our room arrangement was OK for us, despite there only being three of us, separated, with no terrace. We also noticed that english comprehension declined sharply when we complained, but seemed fine otherwise... Again, with hotels in this price range you have to expect certain things, but not getting amenities you pay extra for and being given amenities you don't need or want is a big negative for us. We stayed anyways, just for one night. but not getting the rooms you have booked. This was our honeymoon, and the lack of a terrace for our room left a sour taste in our mouths, especially when the staff really seemed to not care one bit about it. So in the end, we did get a comfortable, clean bed. We just did not get the room we booked, or was able to get any staff member to address our issues such as warm water, damp (maybe mould), and the wrong room type. For this reason, I cannot recommend it, as I cannot trust a facility that behaves in this manner.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel in Rome centre”
Reviews.Author: caledonprotea
Reviews.Content: A perfect little hotel very close to all the major attractions of Rome. We loved being in the center of the city, yet away from the maddening crowds of the main streets. The great thing was that we could walk everywhere. If you did not want to, a bus stopped right in front of the hotel. Our room was small but sufficient, very clean, cool and quiet and a lovely terrace on the top floor of the hotel to enjoy the cooler evenings. Breakfast was enough to carry you over until lunch. The front desk and staff were very helpful, especially Allesandro who helped us plan our daily tours, suggested off the beaten path sites, ordered transportation and recommended a gem of a restaurant just up the street. When we return to Rome again, we will most certainly stay at the Hotel Grifo. Thanks you for making our Rome experience a great one! The Canadian family.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - 5 min from Colosseum, good value for that money”
Reviews.Author: Kukainis
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel one night, I higly recomend this hotel for budget travelers and families with children - it is in walking distance from Station Termini - about 20 min. OK - room was tiny, but clean, bathroom in the room, breakfast nice. Reception staff - very frendly, giving a map, trying to answer any question, giving suggestion for dinning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but skip in the summertime”
Reviews.Author: familyoffourdallas
Reviews.Content: Hotel Grifo was well situated about a 5 minute walk from the Coliseum. Quad room for family of 4 was adequate in size, but air conditioner was very little relief from the Roman July heat. After notifying the desk clerk of our hot room we finally asked for a fan which did help some. A/C in most of Rome seemed to be ineffective against extreme heat, so I don't think Hotel Grifo is alone, but temperature in the room was often warmer than on the terrace. Be forewarned if you travel to this hotel in July or August! Probably a much different experience in the cooler months. Breakfast was included in the room price and was decent, just make sure you get there early in the morning to ensure the best selection.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Grifo in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Briard9
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Rome at the Grifo hotel! It´s a fantastic little hotel in the middle of lovely Rome. You`ll get the most excellent service and as a bonus you can rest, from walking along daytime, on their green roof-terrace in the evenings. Every day you return to a clean room and if it´s hot outside, you´ll have AC inside.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: FigeacTraveller
Reviews.Content: Good value hotel, Small but intimate , good restaurants in the area and close to Most historic sites. Thanks must go to Rose, Louiegi and all the staff who were so helpful with queries We Had Any. We hope to return in the future .

Reviews.Title: “Good for couple'o days' stay”
Reviews.Author: Elena Z
Reviews.Content: I didn't like: Small cramped hotel, small rooms, tiny stairs. When we came, the tiny bathroom smelled of chlorine pretty bad (the smell wared off by end of the day). Very cheap looking rooms with very cheap and old furniture. Not cosy, and I don't do good when not cosy Free space inside the room is almost absent. We stayed for just one night, so it didn't bother us much, but I think it would be uncomfortable to stay there for longer than couple of nights. I liked: Hotel is located near major sights in a clean quiet narrow street, that also has lots of tiny restaurants and shops. The staff was very helpful and friendly and will gladly tell you the best time for Vatican museum visit and location of almost anywhere you want to get and even how to get there. Though the check-in time was around 12PM and we arrived around 10 AM, we didn't have to wait for our room as it was ready. There is an elevator. Good breakfast. Our room faced the narrow street it stands on, the view is nice, it was quiet and nice. There is a bus stop right in front of the hotel, and this bus (#117) goes by most of the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel With a Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: LizabethRose
Reviews.Content: Hotel Grifo is a good hotel in a great location of Rome. Our room was simple yet very clean and comfortable. A very nice feature is the outdoor terrace on the 4th floor - it really is charming and relaxing after walking around Rome all day. In addition to being in a great location, the staff at the Hotel Grifo was the best ever! Everyone was so willing to help in anyway possible.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Chris-808080
Reviews.Content: This trip was an extended family trip to show my Mother the sights of Rome. I chose Grifo for three main reasons and was not disappointed. 1 - Location. It really is excellently located for most of the major sights which are an easy walk away. It is also very near to local conveniance stores, markets, restaurants, cafes and some of the best ice cream in Rome is in the next street over... 2 - The type of rooms. We ordered a family triple which was a double room and a single room next to each other but with an adjoining balcony. The rooms on the 4th floor all have common access to a shared balcony full of flowers that runs out around the perimeter of the building (photo attached). This was one of the true highlights of the hotel. There was nothing better after a busy day sight seeing to sit on the balcony for an hour or two late afternoon chatting about the days events, planning the next day, admiring city life around you and generally unwinding prior to going for dinner at one of the numerous restuarants within minutes of the hotel. The only thing that may put people off this room combo is that our two rooms shared a bathroom which was just across the corridor outside our front door. It was for our use only but take a robe for when you nip out across the corridor. We did not have any problems at all with the arrangement. 3 - The staff were excellent and very knowledgeable about local facilities or tourist opportunities. The rooms are not exactly massive but thats what you expect with historic Rome city centre buildings and most of our time was out sight seeing or chill time was done on the balcony which is covered so even if you get rain you can sit in complete dryness. Sumary Great value for money, excellent service, really good location. I will use it for my next tmrip to Rome and recommend it to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great staff, surrounded by Osteria, Trattoria & Pizzaria”
Reviews.Author: Hokianga
Reviews.Content: Knew the rooms were going to be small as it is a historic building, so was not disappointed. Location was everything we expected in one of the older parts of the city in the Monti District. The hotel is 10 min walk from most of the attractions. By walking you get to see more than you can imagine. Our baggage went to Frankfurt rather than Rome and the hotel staff dealt with the intricacies of Italian baggage handling at the airport to keep pressure on them to get our bags to us. We really appreciated their efforts. The windows were double glazed and had shutters, we slept soundly every night of our 12 day stay. We will stay again when we return to Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location without blowing the budget”
Reviews.Author: Lostoneathome
Reviews.Content: My wife, Angela and I stayed here for seven nights (May 8 to 15) and I have to say that this was a great choice for us. A cute, small place with a pleasant European feel! The staff at the hotel could not have been more helpful; always going out of their way to help us with getting around and giving us recommendations for restaurants. I can tell you that you can trust their recommendations “La Taverna dei Monti” restaurant was a big hit with us as well as other recommendations they made. My wife is of Italian decent and speaks Italian fluently but I speak a scant few words but this is no problem here, as everyone seems to speak at least a couple languages and is willing to help with maps, directions and bus or metro guidance. The location of the Grifo is great, walking distance to the Coliseum, Trevi Fountain, and Spanish Steps. Breakfast is simple but sufficient to get you started on your day. There is free Wi-Fi but it may not reach your room. A great place to stay in Rome , Friendly, clean and budget conscious! I can easily recommend the Hotel Grifo and hope to return again myself!

Reviews.Title: “Great folks and great location”
Reviews.Author: travelinjack3
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for two nights (April 24 and 25) and wish we had stayed for longer. Rosa and the folks there are great and helpful. The family room was large enough and the terrace was great. Great coffee with nice cold cuts and cheese plus yogurt, cereal, jams, and bread. The shower stall was very small and I am very big but I did manage so other folks should be ok too. The location was great. An easy walk to the Coliseum, Forum, Palatine Hill, Capitalone Hill, and train station. The elevator was small but not too small and worked fine. The area around the hotel is great for dining and relaxing with a wonderful gelato place right behind it. While there is wireless internet I did not get a signal in the room so I had to take my laptop down to the dining room.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Helpful Staff and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Berniee81
Reviews.Content: Hotel Grifo was by far one of the best hotel experiences I have encountered in Europe! The hotel staff went beyond the call of duty and the rooms were spotless! The staff were very helpful with information about the city along with terrific suggestions on sights and restaurants. The Location was Excellent. They are only a few blocks from the Colosseum and within walking distance to all major attractions. Had a lovely time here ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: familytravel4x4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights 8th-13th April. Great hotel in a very good location. Nothing was too much trouble. When we arrived were given very useful sight seeing advice so we changed our itinerary accordingly! Saw sights we wouldn't otherwise have seen - so thank you Hotel Grifo! Good family room with lovely terrace, only slight observation, it didn't effect us, but shower cubicle had a very narrow entrance and slightly awkward to get in and anyone who enjoyed large amounts of pasta would struggle to get in! Excellent location for all sightseeing - 5 minutes walk from Colosseum. Brilliant deli round the corner from hotel for fresh sandwiches every day. Good restaurant/excellent restaurants local to the hotel. Best one we found was La Taverna dei Monti and we went there 3 nights out of 5 - excellent food and extremely good value for money, especially the wine.

Reviews.Title: “Middle Historic Rome; Local Atmosphere; Friendly Service; Super Value!”
Reviews.Author: tripahoy8
Reviews.Content: Very friendly English-speaking staff goes extra mile for exceptional help to make the most of stay. Included breakfast offers generous buffet selections. A family feel to this 21-room hotel. Very clean. Elevator. Local area is not "touristy." So, if you wish to practise a little Italian, this is the locale. If not, English is fine. Hotel Grifo-Roma is surrounded by quaint streets, shops, charming local cafes. Major sights are just minutes by foot or by nearby buses. For a 6-night stay in November we paid about what other hotels, within a half-mile radius, were charging for a single night without the breakfast or local charm and ambiance. One of best values encountered in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in the most beautiful street of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: FranziskaBerlin
Reviews.Content: Hotel Grifo is a lovely hotel with terraces on several floors, with plants and flowers on it, as well as tables and chairs. So there is a seating accomodation, mostly in the sun, with a great view over the roofs of other houses of Rome and their just as beautiful terraces.... so that you feel beeing in the south. The room was just big enough with a comfortable bed and a tiled bathroom. When we opened the window, we just looked on one of the churches of Rome and had a great and nice overview (4. floor). The buffet for Breakfast contained italian croissant, juces, as well as cheese, sausage or "müsli" ... The coffee was great. The staff was always friendly and obliging, spoke diverse languages and gave helpful indications for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: hvid
Reviews.Content: Very nice and convenient, the area es very charming

Reviews.Title: “Such lovely helpful people.”
Reviews.Author: munchkin59
Reviews.Content: This is where to stay and get the best out of your stay in Rome. Between the Trevi Fountain and the Collesseum. Everywhere in walking distance (even with a dodgy hip!). We are not seasoned travellers but the staff made all the difference to our stay. There didn't seem to be a language they could not speak, or a limit to the number of questions they answered. The basic room was small but very clean, the hotel was quiet at night (which as we are used to a small village was great), breakfast was plentiful and very good. All the staff's recommendations were great including the local restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Of 20 trips to Europe - best Hotel stay to date!!”
Reviews.Author: eurotraveler32
Reviews.Content: Hotel Grifo was by far our best hotel experience in Europe. My husband and I have traveled all over Europe and found this hotel staff to be the best we have ever encountered. They were extremely helpful with information about the city, tours, restraurants, and transportation. The location is unbeatable, rooms were spotless, reasonable prices and a good european style breakfast included. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “do yourself a favour......stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: blueboyDevon
Reviews.Content: just back from 2 night stay at grifo went with my daughter so booked family triple room it's actually 2 seperate rooms so even better than i thought!( roof terrace as well.) bathroom was spotless as were the rooms breakfast is fine cereal,coffee,tea ,juice, variety of breads etc. special mention to allesandro and rosa who were so helpful (had a very slight problem with a room key but taken care of while we were out )the cleaning staff great too! All the top sights are within walking distance(maybe not st peters but use the hop on hop off bus) no problems in a fantastic city and a brilliant hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was comfortable, enjoyable and a great experience.”
Reviews.Author: BriGe44
Reviews.Content: Hotel Grifo was very accomodating to our large school group of over 20 people. While checking in such a large group had it's difficulties, once we were all settled in everyone was very happy. The hotel's location was nice because the colosseum was just a short walk away. I really enjoyed waking up to the complementary breakfast every morning. The staff was very helpful and aided us in making our plans for sightseeing. Overall, Hotel Grifo left me with next to nothing to complain about, and I'm very glad our group had the great opportunity of staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely "boutique" hotel perfectly located with exceptional staff!!”
Reviews.Author: TakeMeAway56
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at Hotel Grifo after a two week cruise. The hotel is located within walking distance to top "must see" sightseeing in Rome. The neighborhood is friendly and safe. The rooms are small but very clean and adequate. There was a daily continental breakfast included in the cost of the room. But the most outstanding item in this hotel is the staff !! They were the most pleasant, informative and helpful of any place I have ever stayed. If ......when I go back to Rome it will definitely include a stay at Hotel Grifo.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Grifo is GREAT for groups!”
Reviews.Author: jtelfer
Reviews.Content: A group of 21, teenagers, adults, and one youth, decended on Hotel Grifo for a 4-night stay. We couldn't have had a better experience. Alesandro and Luigi at the front desk were very accommodating and helpful. They made our stay extra-enjoyable. The hotel rooms were clean (the maid service at the hotel is impeccable!) and the beds comfy. We were there during Carnivale, so we did have some noise on the streets to contend with, but we were 2 blocks from the main drag, 2 blocks from the subway, and only a few steps from the most delicious gelatto and pizza places! I can't say enough about the breakfasts - substantial and hearty. The best croissants I've ever had! Coffee is hot and delicious, ham, turkey, cheese, cereals, milk, water, juice (delish!!!!), all set in a delightful room with the wonderful ambiance of the 17th century building that houses the hotel. It is a great place to stay, and if I ever go back to Rome, with or without students, I will definitely make Hotel Grifo one of my stopping points. Grazie Alesandro & Luigi!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Amazing Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: jlinds86
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Grifo for 3 nights at the beginning of January. Alessandro was amazing! Upon checking in, he offered us tickets to an exclusive underground archaeological site that only opens for tours one month a year (and sells out immediately.) A couple of friends backed out on him at the last minute, so we were fortunate to be in the right place at the right time, and we went to the tour with Alessandro and his girlfriend. The location of the hotel is wonderful, down a little side street not far from the metro, which made it fairly easy to get to the main sights, though we ended up walking most of the time, as Rome has only 5 metro lines and there is so much to see between the stops. I found our room very comfortable and the size was not an issue. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and will certainly stay here myself when I next return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - friendly”
Reviews.Author: KristyA
Reviews.Content: We were a bit suprised when we arrived - room very small and bathroom even smaller - corridors tiny and the door a nightmare to open at first. But after 5 days, we were happy with our stay and think the reception staff are very helpful, kind and courteous. The cleaning staff do a very thorough job and are also very polite. The upstairs garden balcony was a nice escape. You can easily walk to many attractions from here and there are plenty of good options for dining within a 5 minute walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay at this hotel in the future!”
Reviews.Author: TKKNZ_GRANDPA
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the center of many Rome attractions that are within walking distance. The hotel staff were VERY helpful during our entire stay. They helped on many occasions in making excursion arrangements, taxi/limo arrangements, restaurant suggestions and many of our other needs. This willingness to assist was very helpful to first time visitors in Rome. I would recommend this hotel for both its location plus the attitude and helpfulness of the entire staff.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect location, extremely hospitable and helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Karantanis
Reviews.Content: First of all, the location of the hotel is perfect: it is very close to metro station cavour, it is near the Colosseum, and it is also surrounded by some very nice bars/aperritivos/trattorias. The rooms are clean, not very big, but not small either, and breakfast is much more than what you would expect from a hotel of its category. But the gem of this hotel, is its staff! All of them were very helpful, and especially Alessandro! He provided us with more advices and help than we could even think! The best places to eat/drink, the best museums, unknown landmarks of the city, he also helped us in booking tickets! Grifo hotel hotel is HIGHLY recommended from us, a 27yo couple from Greece!

Reviews.Title: “Most friendly staff and conveniently central location in a quiet street.”
Reviews.Author: Sabina88
Reviews.Content: Great staff, nothing too much trouble. Good comfortable room with balcony on the fourth floor. Shower a wee bit small but every thing else great , good hot water for showering. Breakfast good.

Reviews.Title: “Great all around”
Reviews.Author: Suturer
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Grifo is wonderful!!! Their rooms are simple but exceptionally clean and spacious. The most impressive part of the stay was how resourceful, kind and hospitable the staff were. Everyone throughout the stay treated us like guests to their own home. I will surely stay there the next time I visit Rome. Kayte del Real

Reviews.Title: “A welcome haven after a long day of sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: Thogo
Reviews.Content: Alessandro and Rosa and team are great ambassadors for all that is great about Rome.We stayed 6 days -2 days then a week later 4 days,with family and friends[adults] the quadruple room with balcony suited our purpose very well.Close to excellent restaurants and a recommended freight and private postage service around the corner saved battling the 3 hours queuing at the government post office. Recommendations for not so touristy places to see was also appreciated -especially re Cerveteri.Breakfast had great choices,and generous. We will be back Geniene and Phillip Thogersen ,Sydney Australia

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: freddy01Usa
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice during our recent tour of Europe. Wonderful staff, especially Alessandro (speaks 8 languages) and Rosa. Quiet, cute, safe neighborhood - easy walk to Colosseum, Forum, and lots of other sites. Room spotless, great breakfast!! Very close to Metro/train station.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: babu_kiko
Reviews.Content: the crew is very friendly, due to the fact, that the rooms are small I only can give you 4 stars, but I'll be back anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful reception (day time) but...”
Reviews.Author: beebeebuubuu
Reviews.Content: the location is great, we basically just walk throughout the 2 days and visited almost all major attractions. The rooms were a bit dodgy, extremely small.. I didn't feel very comfortable during my stay there somehow... I just didn't feel the bedding / room are clean etc.. our TV does't work, the reception @ night didn't bother fixing for us, the air con / heater did not work, we have to leave the windows open and it was very noisy, I woke up around 7 times during the night (I always have no problem sleeping through the night).. The reception during the day is very helpful. Gave us suggestions and a map first thing we arrived.. I am sure there are better places to stay in Rome?

Reviews.Title: “Super little hotel, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: hadrian2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at The Grifo Hotel. We really like this place. The location is excellent for historial rome and good for the rest of the central area it is also close to Cavour Metro station. The rooms are small and the hotel clean. The breakfast is good. A nice mix of national guests. All of the staff were suberb. Everyone from the lady who help serve breakfast to the reception staff were happy and helpful. The reception staff were excellent and we didn't need a tour guide after chatting each morning and getting tailormade expert advise on what to see, where to go and how to get there. Local restaurants - pizzerias, tavernas, winebars, indian restaurant good. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Thanks for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for enjoying downtown Rome”
Reviews.Author: marcotanie
Reviews.Content: A few steps from the Colosseum, in the middle of too main shopping street of Rome, cool location!!! The room with the balcony is really nice, it makes you enjoy your staying in Rome (even though in a hotel room) like if you where a real citizen of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Grifo”
Reviews.Author: Rome1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Grifo for 2 days before going on our cruise. Alessandro spoke very good English and that was a plus. He was full of information and gave us lots of advise on what to see and how to get there. The hotel rooms were small but clean and breakfast was included. That was great. Hotel is within walking distance to the Colesseum. I would stay at this hotel again if I am lucky enough to get to Rome again. Thanks to the staff at Grifo

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to go back. I felt so welcome as if I were at home.”
Reviews.Author: Reace
Reviews.Content: The service was wonderful as the staff were so kind and friendly. Our room was on the top floor and we had a view which was great. Our room also had it's own shower and toilet which is always nice to have. It felt cozy as well, like the hotel. The location is wonderful. It was close to the places we wanted to see and go to. The coffee, well the coffee is to die for and the food is wonderful as well. The only problem for us was, we walked to a bus station to go to somewhere we wanted to see and the bus no longer stopped there so we ended up walking a fair distance to catch the bus. Good news, we saw more things doing this.

Reviews.Title: “In one word: fantastic”
Reviews.Author: kasj0peja
Reviews.Content: I was there 2 weeks ago with my friend and payed a lot of attention to feedbacks before chosing the hotel. It's true: rooms are small. but we had what we needed, as they are clean, the breakfast is honest and at the reception we were given the best suggestions to discover the real Rome. Bravo

Reviews.Title: “Lovely time”
Reviews.Author: Loves_Rome
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good value for money. The room was small but well equiped and clean. Although there was a problem with the toilet, Aessandro told us not to worry and it would be sorted out. When we got back from our morning sightseeing - not only had we been given a different room but all our baggage had been moved too. It's in a delightful neighbourhood, which has a lovely village-like atmosphere. There were a number of high quality, low cost resturants near by. It is close to the Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona and many of the major sites in Rome. All of the staff that we met were extremely friendly and helpful. Definately would stay again!.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: aquacrystl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I are a younger couple and were traveling on a budget, and in Rome it is very hard to find a hotel that would not blow a hole in our wallets. But we were very lucky to come across Hotel Grifo. It is in the heart of everything and in a good area. The location is actually quite amazing! You can practically see the Collosium down the street! It is nestled in a tiny street where it is very nice and quiet. When we first arrived there (earlier than our check-in time), the man at the counter was very curtious and spoke English very well. He told us our room was already prepared for us and it was on the thrid floor, which is the highest. It is a smaller hotel but very cozy and welcoming. Our room was not the largest, but for two people who just need a place to sleep and shower, it was perfect. We had a television and a mini-fridge. The rooms are very clean and well kept. Everyday they make the rooms for you. They serve free breakfast in the morning, which was lovely. It included crossants, toast, yougurt, meat, cheese, juice, and cereal. Just enough to gather your energy for a long day of walking. The people that work at Hotel Grifo were all very friendly and helpful. They gave great recomendations for resturants and things to see. I would defintely recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a pleasant and casual hotel room. It is really great for couples. It is no luxery hotel, but it is more than you expect for the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: “A clean, hidden gem in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: orange2star
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is nestled down a quiet city street and is convenient, affordable, and clean. As with most tourists, we spent the majority of our time outside of the hotel. However, we did make great use of our private terrace for a little happy hour before returning to the City for the evening.

Reviews.Title: “I always enjoy my stay at the Hotel Grifo.”
Reviews.Author: LauriUSAWyoming
Reviews.Content: I take small tour groups to Italy in the summers and when we visit Rome we always stay at the Hotel Grifo. it is reasonably priced and the location is superb. It is close to the Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona and many of the major sites in Rome. I love the neighborhood around the hotel. There are very good, reasonably priced restaurants and shops nearby. It is quiet, although it is close to several major streets making bus and metro access easy. Alessandro and his staff are excellent. They are very helpful and give lots of advice about good places to eat and shop. I have had to rearrange reservations for people in my group and Alessandro is always accommodating. The rooms are clean and the breakfast is good. I always request rooms with terraces in the hotel and enjoy sitting outside with a little wine and cheese. Many people in my tour groups have commented how much they enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Grifo.

Reviews.Title: “A great value hotel in a beautiful neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Sherrydarling
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent value for money. It's in the beautiful neighbourhood of Monti, which has a lovely village-like atmosphere. There were a number of high quality, low cost resturants near by. The rooms were small but well equiped and clean. Ours was a superior double and we had a lovely terrace with views on the fifth floor. The showers were fine, we didn't have a problem with them at all. Breakfast was OK, fresh fruit would be a welcome addition. The staff were all helpful and friendly. We're looking forward to staying here again some time soon!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like Family”
Reviews.Author: Larry2136
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights. The man at the desk during the day really made us feel at home. He was very helpful suggesting to us what were the best sights and when they were the least crowded, what areas not to spend money because they gouged tourists, what restaurants were good, etc. We enjoyed just talking to him about Rome. The rooms are plain but we stayed on the top floor where there's a nice terrace. We'll stay here again if we have the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Low Opinion of Hotel Grifo”
Reviews.Author: RajivT
Reviews.Content: We reserved a quad room for 2 adults and 2 children ages 10 and 12. The room and bathroom are not fit for 4 people. The room is gloomy and dark. Air conditioning is not adequate and they turn the A/C off at night. The back door of the room opens to grungy industrial looking equipment and the bathroom window opens into a heating well. The stairs are inconvenient and the overall feel of the room is low class. The location of the hotel is good. I would definitely not recommend the hotel for quad occupancy. For the price, there are other options in Rome that will be better, we stayed in one on our return back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “smallest room ever”
Reviews.Author: knstravel
Reviews.Content: This was by far the smallest hotel room that we have ever stayed in! There is barely any room to open your luggage. And the bathroom...the toilet seat was broken, which was taped together and the shower - you can stand in and that's about it...there is no room to move around (not even to wash your hair). If you are just looking for a place to sleep, then this will do it. There is no frills about this place. There is a metro stop near by, so that made it easy to get around Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lucky Find”
Reviews.Author: walkerrr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a trip to Rome for a quick get away. We didnt know where we were going to stay until we walked up a side street and into Hotel Griffo. The man at the desk "Zorro" was extreemly helpful and spoke good english. He helped us book a room and Rome tours. The breakfast was really great and the rooms were only 90 euro/night. They had wireless internet but wouldnt reach past the 2nd floor but did have a PC in the lobby we could use. The shower was a joke (16 inches x 16 inches) so if u drop the soap u are in a bind. But everything else was great and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Grifo scored high on the priorities: clean, comfortable & convenient.”
Reviews.Author: Poetree
Reviews.Content: As the first place I slept in Rome, the Grifo has a spot in my heart b/c from start to finish, it was a relief. We had never been to Rome for vacation, w/ all arrangements made by us. Hours of reading bad online reviews had driven us to spend more than preferable for our first 2 nights in Italy. Jalel at front desk spoke English. He and other Grifo staff were very kind, helpful, and on hand. I knew to dispense w/U.S. notions of room size for that amt. of money but it was fine, just slightly thrift-shop regarding the decor. A comfortable room, and bed especially. Some storage space in the closet, a clean, decent sized bath w/a tiny shower (tall, big or heavy people wd be vexed), and a pleasant breakfast room with a variety of continental choices. The Grifo serves the tourist trade but is tucked away on a side street and feels cozy to come back to. Colosseum and Trevi Fountain are @15 min. walk in opposite directions. A 3-block walk to the subway and 1 stop to the Termini. Numerous small charming restaurants in the area used by locals, some right on Via Boschetto. I cd imagine some whiny reviews about noise sleeping over the din of a street full of talk, laughter, and motorcycles (on a week night), but it didn't bother us; who cares if you're in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “The right choice for enjoying and exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: SaleBelgrade
Reviews.Content: One of the best holidays. Beautiful Rome would have not be that beautiful if we had not felt that comfortable and welcomed in Grifo hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rome - a great city, friendly people and a quaint hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JennaB10
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at Hotel Grifo at the end of Jan 2009. We had the most incredible stay. Rosa and the other reception staff where fantastic and gave us some excellent advice that made our adventures in Rome all that more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, quiet and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: gooner09
Reviews.Content: My party booked a 4 person room with terrace. Room was clean and terrace appealing. Particularly pleasing was the location in a central and attractive district, but quiet at night. So no problem with the late night Roman noise which one reads about. Made very welcome by reception staff, with helpful advice re local restaurants etc. Able to leave bags pre/post checkout. Good value. Reception staff very happy to speak English in response to faltering Italian.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Some Renovation”
Reviews.Author: misse77_9
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs a little sprucing up. The rooms are small, and the walls are all stained. The cupboards in the rooms have peeling contact paper. The bathrooms also leave much to be desired, you have to push the button on the toilet about 20 times to build up pressure to flush. The tv in the room also did not work for the entire 3 days of the stay. I repeated told the staff but they did nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: 1234Alex1234
Reviews.Content: Great little budget hotel. We booked a triple which was a nice size and clean. The hotel is very basic, so dont expect bell boys, etc.. The guy at reception is super friendly and full of soo much good advice. You are 10/15 mins walk from main train station, but just 5/10 to the Colosseum or Piazza Venezia. The location is excellent, in a typical quiet Roman district! At the right price, this is a bargain and would book here again, no doubts!!

Reviews.Title: “We felt instantly at home”
Reviews.Author: Kongstad
Reviews.Content: Monti is a "little village" in the middle of Rome, and there, in on of the charming, narrow streets, You find Hotel Grifo. On a trip to Rome five years ago we passed this lovely looking hotel and decided to stay there the next time, which we did in nov. 2008. On their website i´d read that the top floors had their own terrace and therefore i ordered one of them. Still, I hadnt actually been indside the hotel and therefore i coldnt be sure that the photos told the right story. They did. High expectations is a dangerous thing, but Grifo fulfilled our hopes for a romantic weekend. And more too. We felt instantly at home. The service was excellent and the room was very nice. We will stay there the next time too, thats for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, quaint hotel in centre of town”
Reviews.Author: Shoushouk
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is brilliant being a short walk from most of the city's most important monuments.. its in a quaint cobbled alleyway which give it the only sense of character it has. The staff are very friendly.. and when we forgot something in the room they kept it for us until our return to the hotel 4 days later which was very sweet of them. We did opt for private bathrooms which is great because the showers on some floors are on the other side of the floor.. and its not really what u want to b doing while on holiday. The rooms are a little small, but you might get lucky and get one with a cute balcony or one of the most spacious rooms. I would opt out of breakfast.. stale cereal adn a few bits of bread really wasnt my thing.. Overall the hotel is excellent value for money, close to town, pretty surroundings.. near the main train station and you couldn't ask for money for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in the hearth of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Margot_zg
Reviews.Content: Great stuff (especially Alessandro... he is great, he speaks several langugages, he know where, when and how to explore wonderful city...). Good breakfast for that kind (star) hotel. Great place to start or complete daily sightseeing, lot's of small shops, restaurants... Actually, you don't need public trasport for lot's of sights... or dinner, or store... But, it's close to metro station on B line (one stop to Termini), close to bus station on Via Nazionale... From Termini station you can walk 10-15 min (well, Rome is on the several hills... :D )... 10 minutes walkign to Colosseum, or Forum Romanum... Clean room, fresh towels every day, small shampoo, AirCondition... italian TV, but TV :)

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Villageidoit
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3N at the Grifo in a really nice room with en-suite bathroom (they aren't all en-suite, be careful when you book if this is important to you). Our room was in a seperate apartment building just a few steps across the street, on the second floor (no lift). Very quiet, spotlessly clean, very comfortable and well appointed. We were very pleased with the room, but the best features of the Grifo are the staff, who were all helpful, friendly and polite - and the location. Good choice of local places to eat/drink and easy walk to the Cavour metro station and bus stops in Via Nacional. Don't walk from the Termini - it's easier by metro.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Grifo!”
Reviews.Author: Katieciz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an absolutely great location, just a few blocks away from the colosseum. We always felt safe, the staff was extremely helpful and friendly, and the price is good for what you get. We had breakfast each morning...nothing fancy, but filling enough for a morning of sightseeing! The hotel staff helped us get a taxi to the Vatican (turned out we could have walked, but it would have been a bit far) and gave us a map and highlighted all of the important attractions. The room itself was a pretty good size (the shower is small, but normal-sized for a European hotel) and the tv was as nice as the one we have at home. We really enjoyed our stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Not a big fan of the Grif”
Reviews.Author: nalexander
Reviews.Content: I knew that we chose the Hotel Grif because of its central location and affordable rates. The rooms were moderate to very small in size but clean. We ended up staying near the roof top deck which was the best part of the stay. However, we did have to share a bathroom with the rest of the hall--a very negative experience given that the cleaning lady banged on the door and yelled one time when I took a shower. They also are not too keen on those who choose to take advantage of the nightlife, despite the advertisement that it has a 24 hour bar. They were accomodating to some extent because they gave guests wine and beer from a 3 foot bench but that was only if we could summon the desk clerk over to assist. Our group checked out on time and the staff was basically friendly, especially at breakfast. The only drawback is that once we returned from our trip, someone from our group was emailed by the Hotel Grif and advised that he was being charged an extra 57 euros for a late check out and for not checking his bill--both claims are false and I believe he is contesting the bill. Overall, the hotel is family friendly and clean but I would not stay there again if given the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely little gem”
Reviews.Author: VinnyAnglesey
Reviews.Content: My mother and I had a great 4 night stay at Hotel Grifo. We had requested in advance that we would require 2 single beds and our request was met. The room was very clean and of more than adequate size. I was relieved that we could sleep well without traffic noise from the major roads. The hotel's location on a quaint cobblestoned side street was fantastic. The metro station "cavour" was a convienient 5 minute walk away. We used the metro as a lazy way of getting around the major tourist sites. Although the tourist sites could easily be reached by foot (Except the vatican).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Breakfast and Staff; Tiny Room”
Reviews.Author: Alissa C
Reviews.Content: My mother and I shared a double room while vacationing in Rome. The hotel itself is located on a very small, one-way sidestreet, which keeps it away from the noise of the city. The staff was incredibly kind and kept watch over our bags so we could go sightsee before check-in time. There is a nice little elevator that really helps with getting upstairs (although it's only large enough for one person + suitcase at a time!). The breakfast was absoultely amazing - a wonderful spread of croissants and other breads, cereals, fruits, condiments, juices, milk and amazing coffee! Our room was well-appointed with a queen-size bed, air conditioning, hair dryer and clothes storage. The only negative thing I can say is that the room was absolutely tiny!! One of us had to sit on the bed for the other to walk around it! And, the shower was only about 16" square, so bathing was a feat. But, even with those drawbacks, I still wouldn't hesitate recommending this hotel - we would definitely stay there again because it was such a nice experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great little place for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: x571
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 3N 4D stay at Hotel Grifo with baby and child in tow. Booked it via their excellent website and at 90 euros a night for a triple with breakfast, it was a bargain. We decided to follow the walking instructions from the Termini. It was a 15-20min walk but being first timers, we were totally unprepared for the cobbled streets and undulating terrain. Should have stuck to the main roads like in our maps and it would be fine. Initially, we were a bit apprehensive about the area. It is on the older part of town but we grew to be rather fond of the place. Didn't feel unsafe when we came back at night time. Location and area ~ walkable to most attractions. Colosseum and the ruins are a short walk away. Trevi Fountain about 20min. walk. Get acquainted with the bus routes which you can catch from Via Nazionale and it is easy peasy. You can also catch the 110 open top bus tour from Via Nazionale. At first glance, the road where the hotel is may look a bit dark and scruffy but you will soon discover small delightful shops - map prints, baby clothes, furnishing, a chocolate shop and even a jazz club. There is a fab pizza place (Pizzaria Leonina) which serves delicious pizza by the weight (about 4 euros for a generous rectangle slice). There are many trattorias around the area where they serve good , solid food. A large plate of hot pasta for 6-10 euros a plate is just what is needed after a long day of sightseeing. Hotel ~ It is quite a small hotel and by no means luxurious. The rooms are spotlessly clean with good housekeeping. We intially booked the family rooms which is actually a double and a single room with no interconnecting door and bathroom at the corridor. It has a terrace which would been quite charming in summer. However, we changed it to a standard triple which is more comfortable for a family with small children. The shower cubicle is about a metre wide and deep so I wouldn't say it is too small. Showers are strong but not hot enough. Breakfast is continental with croissant, bread with jam and butter, cheese and cold meats. Also cereal and you can help yourself to hot drinks. Better to go out and get a real cappucino at the bar. The staff are friendly and knowledgable. I am impressed with their service and my children were fussed over everytime. I would stay good value for money; especially if the highlight of your trip is to discover the Roman Ruins. If you are into shoppping, best to get a hotel nearer to the Spanish Steps

Reviews.Title: “Okay but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Texas_Cyclist
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Grifo. The first night we were so exhausted from the flight that we could have slept through anything. The second night -- lots of noise from outside. Though the hotel is on a tiny street, it is pretty busy with vespas and lots of motorcycle traffic. The third night -- lots of noise from inside. The next room next door was listening to the TV very loud. Then there was some arguing couple at the bottom of the stairs. We didn't sleep well either of those two nights. The fourth night was fine -- I guess because we were exhausted again. The hotel's location can't be argued with. In 4 days we took the bus once and walked everywhere including back from the vatican. The bathroom is small but we are small people and the shower that many people seem to feel is very small is actually bigger than the one we have at home. The mattress is very thin but in two weeks in Italy at 4 places we never had a box spring. Next time, I think we will try for a quieter place.

Reviews.Title: “Very Unhappy With This Place!!!”
Reviews.Author: OperationE
Reviews.Content: I would never stay in the hotel again, and am still dealing with problems related to our stay. We booked well in advance, and despite this we arrived to find that we didn't have a room. We were told that there was a problem with the water, and we would have to stay at another hotel down the street. So, we dragged our child and suitcases down an unfamiliar street at 9 pm to the other hotel (which was nicer and cheaper by the way) with no offer from the hotel to assist in any way, but the man at reception was insistent that we should not pay the other hotel, but should pay Grifo. Later, we realized that was because the other hotel was 25 euros a night cheaper, so Grifo obviously wanted that profit for themselves. At the time, we decided to give them the benefit of the doubt since we had read nice things about the hotel. The next night we arrived at the Grifo, and the room was freezing. When we asked reception about this issue, we were told that there was no heat, so we requested two extra blankets. They then brought us one blanket, as that was all that they could find. And by the way, the beds were not really beds, but cots (no box springs) like one would find in a hostel, and the linens had hair on them. Finally, upon check out, we left in a hurry without closely checking our charge card receipt as we were trying to catch a flight. Upon arriving home, we realized that the hotel had charged us 200 euros above the agreed upon rate for our stay. We have contacted them by email and by phone, and have been told by them that they cannot credit a charge card back, and he asked for my bank details instead (like I'm going to give my bank info to someone that I'm in a dispute with), then we were told that they have other things to take care of right now because someone else walked out without paying, but to keep checking back. Sounds like they plan to recoup what was stolen from them by stealing from us! So much for the respectable, family-run hotel that we had read about before we booked!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Good location, Good service”
Reviews.Author: mayorbarry
Reviews.Content: We had a nice four day stay at the hotel Grifo a few weeks ago. We were on the top floor. As discussed the staff were very nice and helpful. Room was a little small and I have a few minor complaints (the shower was tiny and the toilet ran) but overall a good experience. The private balcony on the fourth floor is outside of the two upstairs rooms and is open to anyone. Not a big deal but not the in-room balcony that I expected/hoped for. Great location and a stunning view of the coliseum after 2 quick left turns outside of the hotel entrance. Some good restaurants and food shops nearby, along with the smell of Indian food from the restaurant across the way which struck me as pretty funny in Rome. Didn't take advantage of the bar untli the last night but got a heck of a pour for 3 euros. Probably our biggest bargain in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel in the Heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Gunnar_OShea
Reviews.Content: From the moment we entered this charming little hotel in the heart of Rome we new we had picked a gem. After registering, the clerk at the front desk took the time to go over the sites that we should see and marked them on a map (provided by the hotel). She also sold us a Roma Pass which was valid for 3 days, covering public transportation and free or discounted entry to Roman sites. TRAVEL TRIP: Buy the Roma Pass. We left our bags (the room was not yet available at 11:00am, no problem) and off we went. The Colosseum, Forum, and Capital Hill are all within easy walking distance from the hotel. Upon returning to the hotel we were pleasantly surprised to find that our luggage had been delivered to our room. We hadn't received this service before. The room was small, but comfortable. Even though the shower was small, it had the best shower head that we found anywhere in our 30 day adventure in Europe. The hotel also had an elevator, something a lot of the smaller hotels do not have. The hotel provided a nice breakfast to start the day off with; warm croissants, nutella, cheese, fruit, sliced ham and turkey, cereal, coffee, juice and milk. The hotel is located not far from the Cavour Metro Station, so it was easy to find. We found that the public transportation in Rome was excellent and bus 19 came right by the hotel's front door. Restaurants were plenty in the area and we found the area safe to walk at night. We would defintely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Small but Friendly”
Reviews.Author: maggiealice
Reviews.Content: Grifo has a very central position. Location is one of this hotels plus points.The hotel is clean, staff very helpful, breakfast usual continental fare, bedrooms on the small side but bed comfortable and bedding crisp. We had no problem with the bathroom, shower very powerful. Used Rome cabs to get from airport to hotel, excellent service from them. A great place for a weekend but dont expect five star treatment.

Reviews.Title: “bad rooms, ok location”
Reviews.Author: ahkow
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a quadruple room for 4 days in August 2007. The location of the hotel was ok, but the room that we booked was below our expectations. The mattresses for the 2 single beds were very thin and uncomfortable. The room was small and cramp, unlike the pictures that were posted on the website. There was practically no where to place our bags and walking space was limited. Not a recommended place to stay unless you are on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: Honia
Reviews.Content: My family booked this hotel for a week, what a mistake. We stayed one night and found a new hotel. The room was small, the bed was only 5 feet long and the matteress was only a couple inches thick. Also, the lamps were attached to the laws with duck tape. The staff was nice but our room was terrible. Hotel Ivanho was cheaper, cleaner, and located by this Hotel. Stay there instead.
